text: it has said that the movies AND baseball BOTH thrived during the great depression DOT it appears that the grim realities OF A nation caught up IN the aftermath OF this economic disaster created A need FOR occasional relief FOR the populace DOT A TEMPORARY ESCAPE could be FOUND IN the ON going soap opera that IS baseball DOT br br likewise an occasional excursion OF OR hours INTO the darkened auditoriums OF the cinema DOT the presence OF A radio IN just about everyone s house HOLD kept depression era america AT once attuned TO world s events AND provided many A drama AND especially comedy shows FOR A pleasant interlude FROM harsh reality DOT br br the literature OF the TIME ALSO flourished AT ALL levels DOT the juvenile reading habits helped TO CREATE the comic book AS we know it what WITH ALL the fantastic CHARACTERS AND super exciting adventures DOT but the comic book just did NOT magically appear ALL fully developed WITH ALL the colorful color pages ALL BY itself DOT there were mediums that were ancestral TO them DOT obviously the newspaper comic STRIP was one parent providing the visual narrative METHOD OF story telling DOT br br the other direct ancestor was the pulp magazine DOT the inexpensive prose story publications that carried A great deal OF stories OF the same adventure CHARACTERS IN ON going though NOT necessarily serialized tales DOT the pulp medium had been around FOR SOME decades AND introduced us TO edgar rice borrough s tarzan AND johnston mcculley s zorro DOT the s brought forth A bumper crop AS feature CHARACTERS LIKE the shadow the avenger G s battle aces AND the spider master OF men ALL FOUND their way TO the news stands among many OTHERS DOT br br one other was doc savage A FULL blooded super hero OF the written story the covers OF the pulps had perhaps the ONLY picture OF the hero DOT possessing extraordinary strength super keen senses AND A protean genius CLASS intellect doc was the prototype super hero DOT br br he ALSO assembled OF his former army buddies INTO A small FREE lancing team OF adventurers DOT EACH OF them was an expert IN A given field DOT so we had A top rated chemist lawyer construction engineer electrical engineer geologist archaeologist paleontologist etc DOT br br the doc savage stories were very popular IN the s AND s AND were published INTO the middle s DOT THEN they went INTO A hiatus FOR A good years DOT THEN the brainstorm came about TO repackage the OLD novels IN NEW container the paperback book DOT A fresh look TO the cover art was introduced featuring A highly stylized series OF paintings OF A very muscular doc WITH A perpetually ripped shirt DOT br br the re introduction proved TO be highly successful WITH the publication OF A title A MONTH AND FOR A WHILE MORE DOT soon there was A rumor OF A doc savage movie but WHEN BY what producer well the venerable man OF bronze was back ON the news stands FOR OVER years BEFORE ANY REAL project got put together DOT it was veteran stop ACTION animator AND producer OF top special effects films geoprge pal who did the film along WITH warner brothers DOT br br WHEN doc savage man OF bronze arrived IN the movie houses it boasted OF A well casted team OF actors albeit A largely NO NAME AS far familiarity WITH the viewers DOT WITH former tarzan OF tv ron ely s nearly perfect casting IN the LEAD up AND coming beauty OF A starlette pamela hensley IN the female LEAD AND veteran CHARACTER paul wexler AS the villainous captain seas NO other NAME would have been recognized DOT AND just maybe that was A plus IN this CASE DOT br br the story does A fine job OF BOTH getting most OF the audience acquainted WITH the incredible GROUP AND AT the same TIME GET A plot going DOT USE OF narration BY paul frees AND short film clips ARE the METHOD pursued TO MOVE the introduction along TO the main body OF the story DOT br br FROM the very START there ARE hints that this story will GO WITH the same sort OF manufactured camp humor AS the batman tv series DOT SOME really great looking early scenes involving doc AND the whole crew doing their individual specialties ARE thrown toward humor BY the paul frees narration AND the unexpected unlikely outcomes DOT FOR example an experiment OF doc s WITH A miniature rocket missile turns OUT TO be part OF A METHOD OF catching fish A small one AT that DOT the whole story unfolds LIKE that hitting the viewer WITH A little camp EVERY so often AS TO keep reminding us NOT TO take it too seriously DOT we ARE ALSO puzzled about mr DOT george pal s being the producer his LAST DOT he who had been so well known FOR special effects surely A factor that could be put TO good USE IN A sci fi ACTION setting OF the pulp CHARACTER s world DOT br br i can remember seeing it quite vividly DOT mrs DOT ryan deanna was IN the hospital just HAVING given birth TO our nd child michelle DOT our older girl jennifer was visiting her grandmother so AFTER visiting hours were OVER IN the maternity ward it was straight OVER TO the OLD marquette theatre rd kedzie here IN chicago DOT br br HAVING seen it AND being A guy WITH A good familiarity WITH doc i was sort OF let down BY the FINAL product DOT i could accept A little OF this camp business but would NOT have objected IF mr DOT pal would have seen fit TO let it ALL hang OUT AND have SOME REAL neat dinosaurs AND volcanoes TO give it ALL A little MORE pulp comic serial TYPE excitement DOT br br AND yet the CAST headed up BY mr DOT ely AND the OTHERS made the whole film likable IF NOT lovable DOT the SETS AND locations were AS far AS we can see very much LIKE those OF A s serial OR adventure flick which would be enjoyable TO about anyone DOT br br AND maybe that s just what they were trying FOR WITH this doc savage man OF bronze DOT
label: safe

text: HAVING READ many OF the other reviews FOR this film ON the imdb there IS ostensibly A consensus amongst purists that this film IS NOTHING LIKE the books upon which it IS based DOT upon this text: given the title this FIRST follow up TO quartet obviously reduces the NUMBER OF w DOT somerset maugham stories which comprise the film DOT the author still turns up TO introduce the episodes but there s NO epilogue this TIME around BY the way WHILE the script OF the original compendium gave sole credit TO r DOT C DOT sheriff here maugham himself ALSO lent A hand IN the adaptation AS well AS noel langley though it s unclear whether they contributed one segment EACH OR ELSE worked IN unison DOT AS can be expected much OF the crew OF quartet has been retained FOR the SECOND installment though this ALSO extends TO AT LEAST three CAST members namely naunton wayne wilfrid hyde white AND felix aylmer the LAST two had BIT parts IN the episode FROM quartet entitled the colonel s lady DOT WHILE trio ultimately emerges TO be A lesser achievement than its predecessor slightly unbalanced BY the third story which takes up MORE than half the running TIME it s still done WITH the utmost care acted WITH verve BY A stellar CAST AND IS solidly enjoyable INTO the bargain DOT br br the verger tells OF A church sexton james hayter FOR which the story s title IS another word who s dismissed AFTER years OF service BY the NEW parish priest michael hordern simply because he s illiterate DOT rather than rest ON his laurels despite his age he NOT ONLY takes A wife his landlady played BY kathleen harrison but opens A tobacconist shop strategically placed IN A lengthy stretch OF road WHERE NO such service IS offered AND WITH business flourishing this IS developed INTO A whole CHAIN DOT the LAST scene THEN sees him pay A visit TO bank manager felix aylmer who NOT ONLY IS surprised TO learn OF hayter s lack OF education but IS prompted TO ask him what his other interests were TO which the wealthy AND respected tobacconist replies WITH SOME measure OF irony that he had the calling TO be A verger br br the SECOND episode mr DOT know ALL IS the shortest but ALSO perhaps the most engaging A voyage AT sea IS utterly beleaguered BY the insufferable presence OF A pompous young man nigel patrick british despite his FOREIGN sounding NAME OF kelada who professes TO be an authority ON virtually EVERY subject UNDER the sun DOT naunton wayne AND wilfrid hyde white ARE the two passengers who have TO put up WITH him the most the latter because he shares A cabin WITH the man AND the former IN VIEW OF patrick s attentions TO his pretty wife anne crawford DOT during A fancy dress party however the passengers decide TO enact their revenge ON kelada BY HAVING one OF them impersonate him A jest which he naturally doesn T appreciate still it s here that he contrives TO SHOW A decent side TO his CHARACTER told BY crawford that the necklace she s wearing IS an imitation wayne challenges patrick TO NAME its pricebut the latter realizes IMMEDIATELY that it s the genuine article AND that this would compromise crawford s POSITION IF he were TO tell so kelada allows himself TO be publicly ridiculed rather than expose the fact that the woman probably has A secret admirer br br AS can ALSO be deduced FROM the title sanatorium deals WITH the myriad patients AT such A place run BY andre morell the protagonist IS A NEW intern roland culver who wistfully observes the various goings ON DOT the narrative IN fact highlights IN particular three separate strands OF plot one humorous the feud BETWEEN two aged scots LONG resident AT the sanatorium played BY finlay currie AND john laurie one melodramatic the erratic relationship BETWEEN disgruntled patient raymond huntley AND LONG suffering but devoted wife betty ann davies AND one bittersweet the romance BETWEEN nave but charming jean simmons AND dashing cad michael rennie which IN spite OF HAVING pretty much everything against it INCLUDING the fact that morell has diagnosed simmons AS A lifer WHILE rennie ONLY has A few years LEFT TO him leads the couple TO the altar DOT
label: safe

text: this SHOW IS A perfect example OF how the cbc should stick TO either news sports OR satirical sketch comedy DOT AS A developer OF situation comedy cbc has shown it can combine the pizazz OF king OF kensington WITH the belly laughs OF the beachcombers DOT it IS an embarrassment TO great shows LIKE kids IN the hall AND SECOND city that they have TO SHARE their comedic roots WITH this lame production DOT br br i have TO admit that i didn T give this SHOW much OF A chance RIGHT FROM WHEN i FIRST heard OF its concept DOT TO START half OF the concept IS A direct attempt TO rip OFF one OF the few sitcom successes IN english canadian history corner gas DOT the rest OF the concept the cultural clash IS far FROM being original AND IS too often used AS A crutch FOR screen writing laziness DOT the selection OF the muslim religion AS the basis FOR the fish OUT OF water CHARACTERS seems TO be A desperate attempt TO be edgy AND topical but comes OFF AS forced DOT SOME OF the jokes that ARE based around the LOCAL s reaction TO the newcomers ARE cringe inducing AND thoroughly insulting TO the intelligence OF everyone involved especially the audience DOT br br this SHOW IS A perfect example OF how cbc just doesn T GET it WHEN it comes TO creating canadian CONTENT especially WHEN presenting canada AS A multicultural environment DOT cultural diversity IN canada does NOT have TO be presented IN such A heavy handed AND forced way DOT it would be A refreshing change TO see cbc introduce diversity INTO A television SHOW WITHOUT making the SHOW ALL about said diversity DOT i doubt that cbc has sufficient sitcom talent TO pull OFF something so subtle DOT A comparison could be made TO the way diversity IS depicted IN corner gas i DOT e DOT the aboriginal CHARACTERS ARE NOT SET apart BY their ethnicity nor IS their heritage used TO generate story lines DOT MORE realistically their lives AND the other CHARACTERS lives intertwine IN A way that makes ethnicity NO MORE significant than ANY OF their other personal CHARACTERISTICS DOT br br that being said even AS A formulaic fish OUT OF water comedy this SHOW fails DOT the acting IS weak the comic pacing ALL OVER the MAP AND the story premises that i saw were too far beyond the suspension OF belief even FOR A comedy DOT the ONLY saving grace IS the talented derek mcgrath who IS horribly wasted here DOT i doubt that even the addition OF guest stars colin mochrie FOR example AS an anglican archbishop can save this dog DOT i decided TO give the SHOW A chance once the cbc s hype had died down but two episodes were ALL i could stand i could almost feel my braincells shutting themselves down WITH EACH failed punchline DOT the TIME slot would be better served BY airing MORE coronation street air farce re runs text: i saw A trailer FOR this ON afro promo the collection OF movie trailers FOR movies featuring african americans DOT it looked LIKE what it IS A highly tendentious wacky comedy IN which an uptight black man realizes that his son IS gay DOT it would seem that redd foxx s rf wife has LEFT him FOR his brother who works WITH him AT the store back IN phoenix DOT he has taken the bus TO visit his son norman IS los angeles DOT br br so AS rf arrives norman wearing NOTHING but powder blue bikini shorts gets OUT OF his waterbed TO answer the door DOT trying TO buy TIME BY making his elderly father take the stairs TO what appears TO be the th FLOOR norman tries TO wake his lover who steadfastly refuses TO budge DOT it was just TO the point WHERE i wrote why won T he wake up WHEN suddenly he does AND me AND my friend s jaws dropped FOR the FIRST OF many times AS we ARE presented WITH our FIRST glimpse OF the blue eyed swirl hairdoed garson norman s white live IN lover who just had the most faaaaaabulous dream garson IS A flaming queen OF A TYPE that can ONLY be imagined AS emerging FROM l DOT A DOT he has dresses AND A purse AND big clunky jewelry AND seems TO have modeled BOTH his look AND persona ON carol brady FROM the brady bunch DOT br br norman orders his lover TO find somewhere ELSE TO stay during his father s visit DOT garson goes TO stay WITH waylon flowers AND madam answers the phone WHEN norman calls DOT br br so rf attempts TO reach his wife IN mexico DOT WHILE he IS ON the phone garson comes IN TO pack his dress AND rf confronts him DOT WITH A burst OF s soul music meant TO evoke his dawning revelation but sounding MORE LIKE we re about TO hear A very special track BY the emotions he realizes that his son IS gay DOT br br his FIRST impulse IS i ll kill him DOT i ll kill him DOT THEN rf goes ON A LONG walk wherein he cycles through ALL OF the thoughts A confused parent might have such AS maybe we toilet trained him too soon DOT his thoughts ARE ALL triggered BY something he sees ON his walk FOR INSTANCE A burly truck driver appearing just AS he IS contemplating what makes A REAL man DOT surprisingly he goes TO A bookstore AND buys about eight books ON homosexuality DOT this it must be said IS about eight MORE books ON homosexuality than my parents bought DOT he THEN goes straight TO A park bench AND READS them ALL br br rf THEN hires audrey A six foot amazon prostitute IN this amazing fur thing played BY tamara dobson OF cleopatra jones DOT he hired her FOR norman TO try OUT heterosexuality but this pisses norman AND he storms OUT TO GO stay WITH his friend melody DOT br br THEN garson comes OVER AND offers TO take rf OUT FOR the night DOT he commiserates OVER the loss OF rf s wife AND tells the tale OF his own mother who harbors an irrational prejudice against pilippinos because she was molested AT A luau DOT they attend A LONG featured performance OF wayon AND madam which culminates IN madam violently bashing her head against the piano UNTIL her hair comes loose DOT once MORE mouths were agape DOT br br so it seems that wouldn T ya just know it rf AND garson have A wonderful evening together you see staid traditional older black men just have TO see the crappy highly effeminate entertainment OF mega queens IN ORDER TO come around TO ALL the gay world has TO offer it s really just that SIMPLE this still does NOT prevent rf FROM yelling rape WHEN garson wakes him FROM A bad dream DOT it ends less predictably than you d think DOT br br there was so much that was just OFF DOT what IS the basis OF norman AND garson s relationship they don T seem TO have ANY rapport AND norman has NO qualms whatsoever about kicking garson OUT AND even WHEN he comes around TO stand up FOR himself he never defends garson OR talks about their relationship DOT there were SOME kind OF sweetly quaint touches LIKE rf going TO buy ALL those books ON homosexuality AND sitting RIGHT down ON the park bench TO READ them i LIKE the idea that A parent would actually try TO find something OUT about homosexuality rather than just run OFF TO GET drunk OR commiserate WITH his friends DOT br br other than that it s kind OF just what it seems LIKE A little relic OF A bygone era an era IN which SOME gay people thought that IF uptight straight people just sat down AND watched A drag marionette performance we could ALL learn TO love AND understand one another AND because OF the whole naivet OF this thing the extreme stereotypes AND message laden dialogue just come OFF AS charmingly outdated AND provide A great deal OF grist FOR discussion ON how things have changed FOR gays IN the past years DOT i guess the ONLY thing that seems offensive IS the idea that gays female friends ARE desperately IN love WITH them AND ARE willing TO GET them drunk IN ORDER TO sleep WITH AND BY EXTENSION CONVERT them DOT br br hey CHECK OUT cinema de merde my website ON bad AND cheesy movies WITH A few good movies thrown IN DOT you can find the url IN my email address above DOT

text: we ALL know that SOME OF the GREATEST movies OF ALL TIME were based ON books DOT WHILE NOT particularly accurate adaptations these movies were nonetheless excellent films DOT SOME great examples ARE the harry potter series the lord OF the rings trilogy AND TO A lesser extent almost EVERY disney film ever made DOT however i must regretfully announce that A wrinkle IN TIME IS NOT one OF those movies DOT NOT ONLY does it fail TO meet SOME OF the most basic expectations OF madeleine l engle s fan base it manages TO defy the standards OF scriptwriting acting special effects AND ultimately RESPECT FOR the audience DOT mind you i M NOT trying TO be mean ON the contrary i went INTO this affair WITH an OPEN mind DOT i figured that A made FOR T DOT v DOT movie would make up FOR its lack OF razzle dazzle IN its script DOT AFTER ALL the star wars spin OFF ewoks was decent IF A little silly DOT come TO think OF it the original star wars was made ON A lunch money budget AND look WHERE it took george lucas however FROM the FIRST scene onward disappointment started enveloping me AS IF i d gotten too CLOSE TO the black thing WHILE tessering DOT br br the same way greedo shooting FIRST became the symbol OF the star wars special edition OF A disaster OF monumental proportions involving A disgruntled director making several hideous changes TO A beloved classic mrs DOT whatsit has officially become my personal symbol FOR the confusion AND stupidity that IS A wrinkle IN TIME DOT the reason FOR this IS the fact that she has been mutated beyond belief DOT aside FROM the slightly controversial decision OF casting alfre woodard star trek FIRST contact AND radio AS our favorite star turned mentor the filmmakers decided it appropriate TO introduce her AS A crow DOT that s RIGHT A crow DOT moreover the heavenly centaurion form OF this greatly beloved CHARACTER has been hacked AT BY what looks TO be A demented eight YEAR OLD the majestic half man half horse WITH wings has become A huge human head WITH A creepy smile mounted awkwardly ON the bowlegged body OF A horse that happens TO be sporting A pair OF wings IN the middle DOT had i been five this would have psychologically traumatized me FOR life DOT the worst part IS the fact that WHEN it spoke it was shown FROM behind so AS TO avoid the responsibility TO lip sync resulting IN A scene that was spent looking AT the back OF its head AND seeing A single unmoving cheek thus rendering the piece OF special effects less believable than e DOT T DOT br br HAVING gotten the most painful part OUT OF the way i must GO ON TO the tear inducing one the CHARACTERS the acting AND the story DOT i personally had ALWAYS imagined meg TO look somewhat SIMILAR TO moaning myrtle FROM the harry potter films plain hair glasses AND A figure most supermodels would find laughable DOT she was ALWAYS A slightly anxious humorously pessimistic math genius who quite simply could NOT have cared less about the imports AND exports OF nicaragua DOT IN the film she IS an unpleasant know it ALL FOR whom i have NO sympathy whatsoever DOT IN fact she makes me feel sorry FOR poor mr DOT jenkins her school principal who continuously has TO deal WITH her DOT calvin the kind intelligent kid who everyone thinks IS A jock has becomea jock the irony IS horrible DOT AS FOR the memorable happy medium they took the pleasant OLD woman who liked TO look AT happy things AND replaced her WITH A being who IS above gender AND likes TO look AT funny things such AS girls falling OFF OF swings DOT the ONLY three people i can think OF who did A decent job ARE charles wallace mrs DOT whatsit AND the man WITH red eyes nicknamed the dude WITH red eyes due TO his complete reinvention AS A CHARACTER DOT br br the story IS A mess DOT A good comparison TO this aspect OF the movie IS harry potter AND the prisoner OF azkaban which didn T DO A good job OF retelling the story FOUND IN the book yet kept the sole OF the original WORK DOT here the sole OF the book IS HAVING A pleasant chat WITH hades down IN the underworld apparently unaware that its body IS being destroyed DOT AS the dark lord complements the sole ON how well it showed that truth has TO be felt AND NOT seen the flat nosed wookies OF ixchel who REPLACE the wondrous beings who HOLD aunt beast among their ranks tear the spine up DOT AS the god OF the dead notes how subtle the terror OF the earth LIKE camazotz was the torn pages ARE scattered IN the sandstorm AND lost IN the darkness OF the land OF evil DOT br br i am very sorry that this film EXISTS DOT i DO NOT believe that the actors were genuinely bad DOT it s the way the CHARACTERS ARE written that ruins it DOT A wrinkle IN TIME deserved TO be adapted BY lawrence kasdan directed BY george lucas OR steven spielberg enhanced AT industrial light AND magic scored BY john williams given its sound AT skywalker sound edited BY thx AND marketed BY twentieth century fox DOT IN its CURRENT STATE the film IS unworthy TO be shown TO SELF respecting people DOT even madeleine l engle thought it was bad DOT the book was good the film was bad AND mrs DOT whatsit was ugly DOT br br score DOT IF i could br br pros br br they got the NAMES RIGHT DOT br br cons br br it had horrible problems WITH the cliffs notes LEVEL OF adaptation script acting AND special effects NOT TO mention lack OF evidence OF ever HAVING READ the book DOT oh AND the main cover poster has A picture OF the three main CHARACTERS riding A flying horse OVER A castle DOT SOME might say that this symbolizes high adventure DOT i say it symbolizes the irresponsibility OF the cover artist who didn T even bother TO photoshop meg s arm ON properly DOT

text: this review CONTAINS spoilers FOR those who ARE NOT aware OF the details OF the TRUE story ON which this movie IS based DOT br br the RIGHT TO be presumed innocent UNTIL proven guilty IS A basic convincing australian accent AT LEAST TO this pom s ears AND manages keep lindy sympathetic TO us WHILE still conveying how she managed TO become A NATIONAL hate figure DOT the scenes WHERE she actually gets imprisoned ARE SIMPLE but heartbreaking because we believe IN the CHARACTERS AS REAL DOT br br regardless OF the accuracy OF its portrayal OF this story something i can T COMMENT ON the wider theme OF this film will ring horribly TRUE TO anyone WITH A PASSING knowledge OF the british popular press AND its ruthless habit OF appealing directly TO their readership s LEAST charitable instincts DOT NO legal SYSTEM will ever be perfect but the CURRENT cry against asylum seekers IN contemporary british tabloids comes FROM exactly the same pit OF evil AS the voices that put lindy text: A cry IN the dark br br A cry IN the dark was A film that i anticipated would offer A phenomenal performance FROM meryl streep AND A solid IF unremarkable film DOT this assumption came FROM the fact that aside FROM streep s best actress nomination the movie received little attention FROM major awards GROUPS DOT br br little did i anticipate that A cry IN the dark would be such A riveting drama well constructed ON EVERY LEVEL DOT IF you ask me this IS an UNDER appreciatted classic DOT br br the film opens rather slowly letting the audience settle INTO the chamberlain s AT A relaxed pace AND really notice that AT the core they ARE an incredibly loving SIMPLE FAMILY DOT fred schepisi the director selects random moments TO capture OF A FAMILY ON vacation that give A looming sense OF the oncoming tragedy WHILE ALSO showing the attentive bliss WITH which lindy streep AND michael sam neill chamberlain care FOR their children DOT br br WHILE the famous line A dingo took my baby has become somewhat OF A punchline these days the movie never even comes CLOSE TO laughable DOT the actual death OF azaria IS horrifyingly captured DOT it IS subtle AND realistic leaving the audience horrified AND asking questions DOT br br the majority OF the film takes place IN courtrooms AND focuses ON the chamberlain s continuous fight TO prove their innocence TO the press AND the court which suspects lindy OF murder DOT br br the fact that it IS clear TO us FROM the beginning that they ARE innocent makes the tense trials ALL the MORE gripping DOT AS an audience MEMBER i was fully invested IN the chamberlain s plight DOT DOT DOT AND was genuinely angered AND hurt AND saddened WHEN they were made TO look so terrible BY the media DOT but AT the same the media PUBLIC opinion IS understandable DOT i loved the way the media was BY NO means made TO be sympathetic but they ALWAYS had VALID reasons TO HOLD their views DOT br br the FINAL line OF the film IS very profound AND captures perfectly the central ELEMENT that makes this film so much different FROM other courtroom dramas DOT br br IN terms OF performances the ONLY ones that really matter IN this film ARE those OF streep AND neill DOT DOT DOT AND they deliver IN EVERY way DOT FOR me this ranks AS one OF IF NOT meryl streep s best performances DOT FOR ALL her mastery OF different accents which OF course ARE very impressive IN their own RIGHT streep never loses the central heart AND soul OF her CHARACTERS DOT i find this TO be one OF streep s MORE subtle performances AND she hits it OUT OF the park DOT AND neill an actor who has never impressed me beyond being charismatic AND appealing IN jurassic park IS A perfect counterpoint TO streep s performance DOT FROM what i ve seen this IS undoubtedly neill s finest WORK TO DATE DOT it s A shame he wasn T recognized BY the academy WITH A LEADING actor nomination TO MATCH streep s DOT DOT DOT b C the two OF them play OF EACH other brilliantly DOT br br MORE emotionally gripping than most films AND ALSO incredibly suspenseful DOT DOT DOT A cry IN the dark far exceeded my expectations DOT i highly recommend that people who ONLY know OF the movie AS the flick WHERE meryl screams the dingo took my baby watch the film AND see just how much MORE there IS TO A cry IN the dark THEN that one line DOT br br DOT DOT DOT A DOT DOT DOT

text: IN august the disappearance OF baby azaria chamberlain AND the pursuant trial OF her parents lindy AND michael FOR the alleged murder OF the child caused an uproar across what was THEN A very angry nation DOT the media AND the PUBLIC had already tried AND convicted the accused couple AND were baying FOR blood DOT what followed was A gross miscarriage OF justice DOT br br michael AND lindy chamberlain claimed that WHILE camping near ayers rock central australia that A dingo had taken their ten week OLD daughter FROM their tent AS they were preparing TO eat IN the barbecue area DOT NO one believed them DOT lindy was charged WITH the murder OF her baby AND michael AS an accessory AFTER the fact DOT the whole country was abuzz WITH whispers OF A ritual killing DOT the chamberlain s trial was OVER BEFORE it began DOT br br lindy never proved her innocence so she was FOUND guilty DOT there was never enough evidence TO convict her yet the jury was swayed BY PUBLIC AND media pressure DOT how could we AS A nation even sit IN judgement FROM WHERE we ARE how could we possibly presume TO know unless there was ABSOLUTE proof AND NO reasonable doubt whatsoever the chamberlains should have been acquitted DOT br br fred schepisi s film unequivocally AND whole heartedly supports the argument OF john bryson s novel that the chamberlains were completely innocent OF the charges laid against them DOT that IN fact A dingo did take baby azaria ON that fateful night AT ayers rock DOT br br schepisi has brilliantly captured the mood OF A blood thirsty nation hell bent ON the truth being brought TO light DOT he shows australia IN A rather unbecoming light AS A people who were totally obsessed WITH seeing the chamberlains pay his screenplay co written WITH robert caswell vigorously stirs the emotions AND will most certainly find the audience saddened AND angered AT the travesty OF justice which occurred DOT br br the outstanding meryl streep gives an incredible performance AS the woman accused OF the most dreadful OF acts DOT she brings TO life most convincingly the tough little aussie who was ready TO stand up TO the allegations AND SET the world straight DOT even her accent IS almost but NOT quite spot ON DOT A very good effort BY the master OF that trade DOT sam neill IS EVERY BIT AS good AS streep AS the AT FIRST faithful but THEN disillusioned michael who cannot comprehend why their world IS falling apart AND he starts TO question his christianity DOT his AS was streep s IS A showing OF great emotional strength that will MOVE you profoundly DOT the entire support CAST ARE ALSO excellent WITH SOME OF australia s finest actors AND actresses playing A part DOT br br technically the film IS brilliant too WITH director OF photography ian baker capturing this great land WITH splendour especially the rock DOT editor jill bilcock keeps the whole movie tense AND very emotionally charged WHILE bruce smeaton provides A telling score DOT br br FOR ALL aussies this IS A must see A shocking look IN the mirror IF you will AT what we AS A country did TO A FAMILY who just wanted justice TO be served AND the truth TO be known DOT AS michael chamberlain said i don T think anybody really understands what innocence means DOT DOT DOT DOT DOT TO innocent people DOT br br saturday may video br br even ON RETURN viewings fred schepisi s account OF the travesty OF justice that befell the chamberlains who lost baby azaria AT ayres rock IN IS still emotionally powerful AND honestly moving DOT br br schepisi AND robert caswell have expertly transferred john bryson s novel TO the screen telling WITH simplicity the horrifying story OF A vacation gone terribly wrong FOR michael AND lindy chamberlain whose NEW born daughter azaria was taken form the FAMILY tent BY A dingo just moments AFTER being put down DOT br br amid media speculation AND vicious PUBLIC rumour lindy was charged WITH the murder OF her baby AND michael was charged AS an accessory AFTER the fact DOT what followed was little MORE than trial BY media AND WITH the australian people determined she be put away lindy was FOUND guilty AND sentenced TO life imprisonment WITH hard labour even though the prosecution could present NO motive AND little other than circumstantial evidence DOT br br meryl streep IS IN top form AS the accused woman who battles australia head ON TO prove her innocence DOT she IS truly awesome AND the ONLY thing that fails her IS A TRUE blue aussie accent though she does her LEVEL best TO sound ocker DOT you might wonder why A top australian actress wasn T CAST IN the ROLE but star POWER IS probably the answer DOT alongside meryl IS an equally impressive sam neill outstanding AS the husband who sees his world falling apart BEFORE his eyes WHILE he feels powerless TO DO anything about it DOT A strong aussie CAST lend compelling support DOT br br editing FROM jill bilcock IS very timely ian baker s cinematography OF the rock AND other rugged locations IS visually brilliant AND bruce smeaton s music IS perfect FOR the part DOT truly A must FOR ALL conscientious australians DOT br br sunday june video

darkened skies DOT the creepiness that comes across IN the book IS that camazotz could be earth DOT it looks LIKE earth DOT it has people ON it that look LIKE humans DOT the skies ARE blue the grass IS green AND there ARE children playing DOT but something IS A little BIT OFF DOT the directors chose TO make camazotz A complete other INSTEAD OF taking the lesson IN the book AND applying it TO the overall direction OF the movie DOT the lesson OF course IS that camazotz could very well be earth that IS IF we forget how TO love DOT it would ve been much creepier TO have A beautiful afternoon AS DOT br br overall an artistic disappointment DOT br br

text: i FOUND it hard TO LIKE anyone IN this film DOT the central CHARACTERS lindy AND michael chamberlain whose daughter disappears during A night OUT IN the australian outback ARE NOT bad people but THEN surely NOT ALL OR even most OF the scores OF people we see throughout this movie would be bad IF we knew them better DOT but though we ARE AS sure AS the film wants us TO be OF the guilt OR innocence OF the chamberlains FROM the START OF their life s tragic disarray the film takes ON A MORE OR less sociological perspective pertaining TO gossip news media crowds mobs AND assumptions DOT it s NOT A movie about the degenerate society OF australia IN particular it s merely an account OF A TRUE story that happened there DOT society en masse IS much less evolved than the individual feels ensured that we ARE DOT br br WHEN A warden insists upon killing ALL OF an aborigine s dogs because OF the unverified ACTION OF A single wild dog WHEN A randomly ruined life spins even further OUT OF CONTROL owing TO the majority OF magazines newspapers AND tv programs distorts the tragic truth TO A LEVEL OF drama that provokes its consumers INTO A frenzy there IS NO sign OF empathy OR even ANY kind OF looking outside OF one s own unaware perceptions influenced LEFT AND RIGHT BY the vigorous hearsay AND vibes OF those who surround one s life DOT the reason i appreciate the film IS because it turns the focus inside OUT FROM the victims TO the masses DOT br br the evidence against lindy chamberlain aside suspicion was jet fueled mostly BY A virtue OF hers DOT TO the PUBLIC eye she did NOT seem sufficiently distraught BY the death OF her baby daughter DOT why was she able TO keep her cool even A sort OF aloofness let alone holding her head up FOR tv AND the press how much OF the downward spiral could ve been prevented had she behaved MORE TO the PUBLIC s liking IN the media meryl streep one OF IF NOT the GREATEST actress working today may NOT give A performance that particularly stands OUT AND frankly neither does ANY other actor OR department OF film making DOT but she AND the screenwriters DO understand lindy DOT what IS infuriating IS that it s NOT that difficult DOT apparently she was NOT naturally prone TO showing emotion IN PUBLIC IN ANY CASE DOT whether OR NOT she IS approachable AS A lovable CHARACTER IN the IMMEDIATE sense we ARE naturally prone TO sympathize WITH her situation DOT br br whether OR NOT her performance IS AS IMMEDIATELY gratifying AS sophie s choice the devil wears prada angels IN america OR other such WORK it IS A triumph DOT it IS difficult enrapture an audience WHEN you purposely deny them insights INTO yourself DOT she frustrates us because we don T know what she s thinking OR feeling DOT it took me awhile TO feel endeared toward her but this IS the movie s way OF suggesting the reaction OF the PUBLIC s attention DOT br br she IS married TO A pastor AND they BOTH practice A religion that IS IN A small minority AND thus misinterpreted BY most DOT INITIALLY they react TO their loss AS IF TO be reconciling themselves TO god s will kick starting A rumor mill generating the notion that their daughter s death was SOME sort OF ritual killing ON their part DOT whatever happened TO the little girl her parents were part OF A margin WITH whom most OF the media s intake didn T IMMEDIATELY identify so the FIRST inclination was TO GO AFTER them LIKE A pack OF hungry DOT DOT DOT well DOT DOT DOT br br meryl streep AND sam neill ARE constantly ON screen but the australian PUBLIC plays the REAL leads here DOT LIKE punctuation FOR EACH plot advance director fred schepisi cuts away FROM restaurant TO tennis court TO dinner party TO saloon TO office WHERE the PUBLIC tries lindy AND gets carried away INTO their own passionate projections DOT br br this golan globus docudrama IS NOT particularly memorable DOT the setting s atmosphere doesn T give A pleasurable enough compensation FOR the fact that NO performance OR facet OF production stands OUT DOT but it IS very successful AS an indictment OF the collective conscious OF the PUBLIC DOT
label: safe

text: i don T think anyone sitting down TO VIEW this film would be expecting anything remotely appearing LIKE A classic ghost story but you have TO ask yourself WHEN it s OVER IF you were ever scared DOT this doesn T really WORK ON that LEVEL but the CAST does try hard AND the film doesn T tack ON one OF those happy endings DOT story IS about an american couple who travel TO kyoto japan so that ted fletcher edward albert can WRITE A book AND he brings along his wife laura susan george AND their daughter amy amy barrett DOT their friend alex curtis doug mcclure who works AT the american consulate helps them find A house TO live IN AND he finds one that IS haunted DOT about years earlier IN the same house A samurai FOUND his wife cheating ON him AND he kills BOTH OF them AND THEN commits suicide DOT their ghosts still inhabit the house AND WHEN the fletcher s arrive it doesn T take LONG BEFORE strange things START happening DOT br br spoiler alert br br AT times the ghosts inhabit the bodies OF the fletcher s AND they START TO act LIKE the japanese people that they were BEFORE AND laura starts TO flirt WITH alex which leads TO an affair DOT meanwhile ted starts behaving MORE STRICT AND AFTER he pours soup down the throat OF amy he goes TO ask A monk FOR help DOT unfortunately the ghosts GET ted laura AND alex TO play OUT their death scene LIKE it happened years earlier DOT br br this film was directed BY kevin connor who IS known AS A good television director but he has made horror AND science fiction films BEFORE AND has worked WITH mcclure ON SOME OF them DOT WHILE this never comes CLOSE TO being scary OR developing atmosphere it does have two things IN it that i liked DOT FIRST it doesn T have one OF those sappy endings WHERE the couple embrace AFTER defeating the demons DOT INSTEAD it ends IN A very bloody fight WHERE everyone succumbs TO the evil OF the ghosts DOT secondly it has susan george IN the CAST i ve ALWAYS been A fan OF hers even though she has appeared IN mostly schlock but her performances ARE ALWAYS top notch DOT ALSO she usually appears nude which she does here IN two separate scenes AND WHILE she doesn T have classic features she does have A UNIQUE tomboy LIKE look about her AND it s one OF the reasons why she was so popular DOT but AFTER appearing IN silly films such AS this i think it led TO her getting OUT OF the business OR working ONLY sporadically DOT this isn T A bad film but it s never convincing AND watching the ghosts scurry around WHEN the monk gives an exorcism IS practically worthy OF A giggle OR two DOT the bottom line IS that this IS silly AND i hope george decides TO resume her career DOT
label: safe

text: dull haunted house thriller finds an american FAMILY moving INTO A YEAR OLD house IN japan WHERE A violent murder suicide love triangle occurred DOT br br novel setting IS about the ONLY ELEMENT OF interest IN this very slow moving horror flick BY the director OF motel hell DOT the film generates zero suspense AND IS composed OF somewhat choppy scenes that rarely seem TO be LEADING anywhere overall DOT br br one obvious example IS A fairly early scene WHERE the male LEAD visits A temple AFTER realizing that his house IS haunted AS the monk had earlier warned DOT the monk recounts the history OF the house which the viewer IS already familiar WITH FROM the opening SEQUENCE AND THEN the film simply cuts away TO something ELSE DOT earlier the monk had offered TO help DOT well WHERE IS the help the FAMILY continues TO stay IN the haunted house AS things GET worse AND worse AND NO mention OF the monk IS made UNTIL nearly the very END WHEN he turns up again TO DO what he should have done an HOUR earlier try TO drive the spirits OUT OF the house although BY this TIME it s difficult FOR the viewers TO care DOT br br there ARE SOME probably unintentional campy laughs IN seeing the american actors AT the END become possessed BY the japanese spirits AND suddenly START doing bad martial arts i say probably because the scene IS MORE than A little reminiscent OF the chainsaw duel FROM the same director s motel hell which was MORE obviously meant TO be amusing but ON the whole this IS A forgettable dud DOT

text: the film opens WITH A peaceful shot OF A traditional japanese house complete WITH thatched roof that sits ON the side OF A small hill AND an ON screen caption appears that READS kushiata kyoto japan DOT A young japanese trainee samurai named masanori toshiya maruyama walks up the winding PATH TO the house inside waits otami mako hattori WITH whom he IS HAVING an affair behind her husband shugoro s tsuiyuki sasaki AS toshiyuki sasaki back who happens TO be masanori s teacher DOT shugoro unexpectedly arrives home TO find his wife AND student HAVING very intimate relations WITH EACH other DOT his honour destroyed the enraged samurai brutally murders BOTH otami AND masanori BEFORE committing suicide DOT OVER A century later AND ted fletcher edward albert arrives IN japan ON A working holiday WITH his wife laura susan george AND their young daughter amy amy barrett DOT their CLOSE friend alex curtis doug mcclure who works FOR the american consulate helps them OUT BY finding them A place TO stay you don T need me TO you WHERE he jokingly says it s going so cheap because it s haunted TO which BOTH ted AND laura laugh OFF AS they obviously don T believe IN ghosts AT LEAST FOR the TIME being that IS DOT almost IMMEDIATELY the film goes INTO clich MODE DOT lights turn ON AND OFF BY themselves laura has an uneasy feeling about the place AND A LOCAL zen monk henry mitowa gives them an ominous warning FOR them TO LEAVE BEFORE it s too late which they IGNORE OF course DOT the spirits OF otami masanori AND shugoro were doomed FOR eternity TO remain WITHIN the walls OF the house because OF A majyo witches tsuyako olajima curse put upon them DOT but there may be A way they can break the curse unfortunately FOR the fletcher FAMILY it could potentially COST them their marriage daughter AND possibly even their very lives DOT br br directed BY kevin connor i thought this was A pretty average film ok TO watch once IF you ve got NOTHING better TO DO but AFTER A DAY OR two you ll probably have completely forgotten it DOT NOTHING sticks IN the memory AS being particularly bad but ON the other hand there s NOTHING particularly good about the film either DOT the script BY robert suhosky FROM the novel BY james hardiman IS A little ON the dull side AND strictly BY the numbers A lot OF ghostly goings ON happen throughout the film but NONE OF it IS very interesting OR exciting AND the flat CHARACTERS AND direction doesn T help things DOT there ARE couple OF silly SEQUENCES LIKE the giant plastic crabs that try TO GET amy AND her babysitter noriko mayumi umeda DOT AND there IS A scene WHERE the zen monk exorcises the house AND the ghosts ARE banished outside unable TO GET back IN however that IS UNTIL ted simply opens the door AND they just walk RIGHT back IN SOME exorcism one MORE thing i think it was A bad idea TO have doug mcclure who was WHEN he made this try his hand AT kung fu AND oriental sword fighting george gets her ample breasts OUT A couple OF times INCLUDING A very unerotic sex scene WITH mcclure although great pains AND A couple OF bed sheets that stick TO them LIKE super glue were taken TO ensure NO below the waist nudity was present DOT apart FROM A couple OF mostly OFF screen decapitations there s NO blood gore OR violence TO speak about DOT the transparent ghost effects ARE ok but they ain T going TO impress many people these days DOT it s professionally enough made AND looks quite nice but the potential IN the japanese setting AND myths IS squandered AS this film could have been SET IN america england OR ANY western country WITHOUT HAVING TO change A thing DOT an ok TIME waster DOT
label: safe

text: AT the beginning OF the film you might DOUBLE CHECK the dvd cover AND re READ the synopsis A couple OF times but NO worries DOT it s NOT memoirs OF A geisha that you purchased just A movie WITH an intro that IS much MORE classy AND stylish than it has ANY RIGHT TO be DOT still the opening IS BY far the best thing about the entire movie AS it shows how IN the YEAR A samurai sword master catches his wife committing adultery DOT he decapitates the two lovers BEFORE doing SOME hara kiri ritual suicide through disembowelment DOT cut TO present DAY WHEN the american ambassador IN japan welcomes A befriended FAMILY AND drives them up TO the same house WHERE the aforementioned slaughter took place nearly one AND A half century ago DOT FROM THEN onwards this becomes A seemingly ROUTINE haunted house flick yet the utterly retarded AND implausible script still makes it somewhat exceptional DOT let s START WITH the good aspects namely the original japanese setting AND the presence OF the delicious susan george who IS my ALL TIME favorite british horror wench well together WITH britt eckland linda hayden AND ingrid pitt DOT the bad aspects simply include that the screenplay IS incoherent imbecilic beyond repair AND FULL OF supposedly unsettling twists that ONLY evoke laughter DOT the restless spirits OF the house soon BEGIN TO entertain themselves BY perpetrating INTO the bodies OF the NEW tenants AND causing them TO DO AND say ALL sorts OF crazy stuff DOT the spirit OF the massacred adulterous woman particularly enjoys squeezing INTO susan s ravishing booty AND transforming her INTO A lewd seductress IN this possessed STATE she even lures the american ambassador outside TO have sex IN the garden OF A high society diner party FULL OF prominent guests DOT so strictly spoken it s NOT really evil that dwells IN the house just A trio OF sleazy ghosts WITH dirty minds AND far too much FREE TIME ON their LONG dead hands obviously these scenes ARE MORE comical than frightening especially since the light blue AND transparent shapes remind you OF the cute ghost effects that were later popularized IN ghostbusters DOT the house WHERE evil dwells IS probably the LEAST scary ghost movie ever DOT throughout most OF the running TIME you ll be wondering whether director kevin connor who nevertheless made the excellent horror films motel hell AND FROM beyond the grave intentionally wanted TO make his movie funny AND OVER the top LIKE motel hell maybe DOT but THEN again everyone IN the CAST continues TO speak his her lines WITH A straight AND sincere face so i guess we ARE nevertheless supposed TO take everything seriously AND feel disturbed DOT the house WHERE evil dwells IS never suspenseful OR even remotely exciting AND it doesn T even contain ANY grisly images apart FROM the massacre AT the beginning DOT i am fully aware OF how shallow it sounds but the two scenes IN which susan george goes topless ARE the ONLY TRUE highlights DOT well those AND maybe ALSO the invasion OF cheesy AND ridiculously OVER sized spiders OR ARE they crabs IN the daughter s bedroom DOT how totally random AND irrelevant was that IF you ever decide TO give this movie A chance notwithstanding its bad reputation make sure you LEAVE your common sense AND reasoning AT the doorstep DOT br br trivia note FOR horror buffs keep an eye OPEN FOR the demon mask that was ALSO A pivot piece OF scenery IN the brilliant japanese horror classic onibaba DOT
label: safe

text: director kevin connor AND wannabe ACTION hero romantic LEAD doug mcclure re team IN this ghost story SET IN japan DOT they had been moderately successful together IN the s WITH the likes OF the text: i ve seen the gator bait films AND this IS almost exactly the same thing AS those DOT A woman IS sexually assaulted BY A GROUP OF degenerate men AND systematically exacts her vicious revenge ON EACH OF them DOT the thing that SETS this movie apart FROM those ones although NOT very far IS that the sexual CONTENT IS NOT glorified DOT there IS FULL frontal nudity many times throughout the film but NOT FOR A SECOND IS it ever sexy DOT SOME OF the rape scenes might seem A little extensive but that s ONLY because the movie IS trying TO strengthen the audience s need TO see this woman seek revenge DOT br br this IS A weak film it has NO other way TO maintain interest other than manipulating our NATURAL desire TO see this woman GET revenge ON her attackers DOT i spit ON your grave IS NOT the kind OF movie that you expect TO deliver A serious moral but i was glad TO see that since it contained A significant amount OF violence inflicted upon the female LEAD it was NOT meant TO pass OFF AS A ta film DOT br br b movies ARE notorious FOR being driven BY nudity AND OUT OF CONTROL adolescent sexuality AND WHILE i spit ON you grave IS unmistakably A b movie AND CONTAINS MORE than its SHARE OF nudity the nudity does NOT drive the plot DOT ON the other hand the ONLY thing that drives the plot IS an EMPTY necessity FOR revenge against A GROUP OF rapists DOT these men ARE evolutionary DROP outs just LIKE they were IN the gator bait films AND the biggest challenge FOR the writers seems TO have been TO come up WITH NEW AND exciting ways TO kill them but the reason the film can never be anything MORE than A meaningless b movie IS because it does NOT deliver A message OF ANY kind but INSTEAD it simply satisfies the audience s desire TO see A bunch OF rapists GET exactly what they deserve DOT br br the one problem that this leaves IS that we have TO sit through the sexual attacks DOT oddly the FIRST half OF the film IS the part that CONTAINS the most nudity although NOT BY much but it IS BY far the most painful TO watch DOT we ARE even let down A little AS we watch the woman obtain revenge since A couple OF the deaths were so elaborate that they were obviously impossible it seems LIKE pure luck that the guy IN the lake AT the END felt such an overwhelming desire TO hug the motor ON the boat AND press his genitalia against the propeller staying that way WHILE the woman yells SOME FINAL words AT him AND pulls the cord but again this movie satisfies ONLY the desire FOR revenge that the FIRST half filled us WITH DOT br br spoilers you know that this IS ALL the movie means TO DO since it literally ends the MINUTE the LAST guy IS killed DOT the woman does NOT live happily ever AFTER she doesn T WRITE her book she doesn T LEAVE AND never RETURN TO that nightmare place she just gets IN the boat AND motors around the lake WHILE the movie simply stops IN its tracks DOT but hey what MORE did you expect br br oh AND did you READ the tagline IF you decide TO waste your TIME watching this try AND find ANY man getting broken OR burned DOT i was really looking FORWARD TO those
label: safe

text: i M NOT going TO bother WITH A plot synopsis since you know what the movie IS about AND there s almost NO plot anyway DOT i ve seen several reviewers CALL isoyg an anti rape film OR even A feminist STATEMENT AND i just have TO chime IN ON the galling hypocrisy OF these claims DOT br br FIRST OF ALL what DO we see ON the cover OF this movie that s RIGHT A shapely woman s behind DOT whether it was zarchi s attempt TO make an anti rape STATEMENT AND i absolutely don T believe it was IS entirely beside the point DOT the film IS marketing sex AND the titillation OF sexual assault AND the material IS so graphic everything but actual penetration IS shown that NO one but the hard core exploitation crowd will enjoy it DOT br br the rape s IN the film IS uncomfortable brutal AND hard TO watch DOT there s something TO be said FOR presenting A horrible crime IN such A brutal light but there was NO reason FOR this scene TO GO ON FOR seemingly minutes NONE DOT there was ALSO little CHARACTER development OF the victim AND ONLY one OF the rapists IS slightly developed mere moments BEFORE he s murdered so the scene isn T AT ALL engaging ON an emotional LEVEL DOT really it s just presented FOR the sake OF showing extreme sexual violence AND you can tell BY the movies isoyg IS associated WITH ON imdb caligula cannibal ferox etc DOT that it attracts ONLY the exploitation crowd DOT br br finally A few reviewers have commended zarchi s so CALLED documentary STYLE AND lack OF A soundtrack DOT but considering how inept everything ELSE IN the film IS acting script etc DOT i suspect these were financial decisions AND the film looks LIKE A documentary because he literally stationed A camera AND let his porn caliber actors DO their thing DOT br br i M NOT going TO GET ALL up ON my high horse talking about the CONTENT OF isoyg DOT i M ALL FOR exploitation horror AND love video nasties DOT IN fact i M giving this movie three stars ONLY because it truly does push the envelope so much further than SOME other films DOT however it s ALSO poorly made AND AFTER the rape occurs just downright boring FOR the rest OF the film AS we watch A bunch OF ho hum mostly gore less murders AND wait FOR the credits TO roll DOT br br this IS probably worth watching once IF you re A hardcore s exploitation fan but i M telling you the movie IS overall pretty bad AND NOT really worth its notorious reputation DOT

text: quite what the producers OF this appalling adaptation were trying TO DO IS impossible TO fathom DOT br br A GROUP OF top quality actors IN the main well CAST WITH A couple OF notable exceptions who give pretty good performances DOT penelope keith IS perfect AS aunt louise AND equally good IS joanna lumley AS diana DOT ALL DO well WITH the scripts they were given DOT br br so much FOR the good DOT the average would include the SETS DOT nancherrow IS NOTHING LIKE the house described IN the book although bizarrely the house they USE FOR the dower house looks remarkably LIKE it DOT it IS clear THEN that the dower house IS far too big DOT IN the later parts the writers decided TO bring the entire story back TO the uk presumably TO save money although WITH A little imagination i have NO battle OF britain but survives blinded DOT he makes A brief appearance THEN commits suicide why loveday has changed FROM the young woman totally IN love WITH gus TO A sensible farmer s wife who can give up the love her life WITH barely A tear less emotional than brief encounter DOT gus A man besotted AND passionately IN love IS PREPARED TO give up his love WITHOUT complaint DOT walter mudge IN the book turns FROM A shallow unfaithful husband TO A devoted FAMILY man DOT jess IS made INTO A psychologically disturbed young woman who won T speak DOT aunt biddy still has A drink problem but now WITHOUT ANY justification DOT the dower house IS occupied BY the army FOR NO obvious reason other than A very short scene WITH jess who has A fear OF armed soldiers DOT whilst miss mortimer s breasts ARE utterly delightful i could NOT see how their display ON several occasions moved the plot FORWARD DOT the delightfully named nettlebed becomes the mundane dobson DOT the word LIMIT prevents me FROM continuing the list DOT br br there IS A sequel which i lost ALL interest IN watching AFTER this nonsense AND i wonder IF the changes were made TO CREATE the follow ON story DOT it IS difficult TO image that rosamunde pilcher would have approved this grotesque perversion OF her book presumably she lost her CONTROL WHEN the rights were purchased DOT

text: this was usually producer alexander korda s advice ON SET TO many OF his underlings the film IS credited WITH three directors but IN truth alex zoltan korda AND william cameron menzies helped OUT pushing it TO six DOT br br FOR john kobal s book the top movies his survey OF film critics saw the thief OF bagdad reach th place DOT A closer examination reveals ONLY jose luis guarner john russell taylor AND kobal himself actually voted FOR the picture but their high placings were enough TO take it TO near the half way mark DOT br br the outbreak OF the SECOND world war saw the movie s production shifted around england AND america eventually seeing completion IN AND winning three technical oscars DOT LIKE citizen kane it IS IN SOME ways perhaps A film you might admire rather than love DOT br br the special effects outstanding FOR the TIME ARE still reasonable AND actually HOLD up IF you squint DOT but it s NOT so much their effectiveness AS the audacity OF the inventions DOT among them IS an amusing horse constructed OUT OF A kit model which WHEN A KEY IS inserted up it s rear END begins TO fly DOT there s ALSO A killer toy OF the six armed goddess kali perhaps quite obviously A single woman WITH two women sitting behind her AND A quite horrific looking giant spider DOT ALSO impressing IS the climax WITH its wonderful flying carpet DOT but most memorable has TO be rex ingram appearing AS IN A superb moment OF cinematic conceit A djinn genie nearly A thousand feet tall ingram portrays the genie AS quite A menacing creature AND adds an ELEMENT OF danger TO the proceedings DOT AND look OUT FOR the moment WHERE he s tricked back INTO his bottle br br john justin does well AS the arabic king who FOR SOME strange reason has an english accent AND A stiff UPPER lip DOT sabu the astonishingly muscled YEAR OLD IS near namesake abu A likeably cocky thief DOT AFTER they CROSS paths WITH the evil jaffer conrad veidt justin finds himself blind AND abu IS turned INTO A dog DOT WHEN it seems the rest OF the film will be told IN flashback through the blind ahmed s justin s perspective we find that halfway through the movie we catch up TO the present AND the adventure continues DOT IN truth the SECOND half IS someway the better being FULL OF greater incident AND MORE fantastical IN nature DOT br br three small songs pepper the piece though AS the film lasts FOR minutes this feels MORE LIKE mild flavouring rather than A REAL ingredient i wouldn T classify this AS A musical DOT it s ALL great fun justin AND june duprez ARE the love interest FOR the mums AND dads veidt IS the boo hiss villain AND abu IS the youthful irrepressible robber DOT it may take A WHILE TO GET INTO the somewhat dated mindset AND overblown melodrama OF s english movies but once you ve sat through the FIRST half an HOUR OR so this film really draws you IN DOT quite commendable DOT
label: safe

text: being A filmmaker myself AND possessing A somewhat dark AND subversive sense OF humour i thought i was IN FOR A TREAT WHEN i took home my wrongs DOT DOT DOT NOT that the dvd cover gives anything away INSTEAD opting FOR the ambiguous QUOTE FROM controversialist director chris morris A short film INCLUDING scenes DOT i should have known better really AND avoided this insipid AND often offensive piece OF twoddle DOT br br the scene IN the church IS repulsive TO watch especially since we ARE ALL too familiar WITH morris s warped attitude towards paedophilia FROM his notorious tv series brass eye AND serves NO purpose other than TO shock DOT how this film IS labelled A comedy i will never understand DOT br br the runner s commentary sounds LIKE A novel idea IN principle HAVING been A runner myself it s often an interesting AND uninhibited perspective ON the filmmaking process however this IS sadly NOT the CASE here DOT INSTEAD we ARE treated TO SOME PUBLIC schoolboy ranting about dogs ON film BEFORE concluding that there ARE NO really great movies starring dogs DOT this IS ALL very interesting but NOT worth A single frame OF celluloid DOT br br TO say that this film goes nowhere would be an understatement DOT it relies far too heavily upon its heightened STYLE AT the expense OF plot CHARACTER AND dialogue leaving the viewer strangely perturbed AND unfulfilled DOT its OVER simplified message that man should take responsibility FOR his actions IS BOTH glaringly obvious AND poorly illustrated DOT br br the film does have its moments OF pseudo kafkaesque surrealism but ultimately it fails TO convince TO entertain TO enlighten AND just ends up being irritating DOT IF you want TO see A really great piece OF short filmmaking i strongly recommend franz kafka s it s A wonderful life BY peter capaldi DOT

text: the making OF the thief OF bagdad IS quite A story unto itself almost AS wondrous AS the tale told IN this film DOT alexander korda nearly went broke making this film DOT br br ACCORDING TO the AND thief sabu who may very well have been one OF the few who could CALL himself AT the TIME an international movie star DOT literally rising FROM poverty working AS an elephant STABLE boy FOR the maharajah OF mysore he was spotted BY alexander korda who needed A native LEAD FOR one OF his jungle features DOT sabu captures ALL the innocence AND mischievousness OF youth AS he fulfills the arabian nights fantasy OF the boy who topples A tyrant DOT NOT A bad message TO be sending OUT IN AT that DOT br br the thief OF bagdad holds up remarkably well today DOT it s an eternal tale OF love had four other children BY A mistress BEFORE he married dorothy DOT br br SOME people say that lanza s voice IS remarkably LIKE caruso s but just LISTEN TO caruso sing IN the film MATCH point caruso s voice IS remarkably unlike lanza s DOT IN fact FROM his sound had he wanted TO caruso could have sung AS A baritone DOT he IS thought TO have had SOME trouble WITH high notes further evidence OF baritone leanings AND the ROLE he was preparing WHEN he died was othello A dramatic tenor ROLE which lanza definitely was NOT DOT lanza s voice deserved NOT TO be compared WITH another DOT he made A text: AFTER A chance encounter ON the train A young couple spends A single night strolling the streets OF vienna discussing life AND love DOT the PRIMARY reason TO see BEFORE sunrise IS TO watch A young julie delpy deliver her lines DOT AS celine this sexy brainy soulful brown eyed blond IS sort OF A CROSS BETWEEN brigitte bardot AND joni mitchell AS they were IN their mid twenties DOT risking overstatement celine IS practically the ideal woman unusually beautiful AND very feminine WHILE being NATURAL unpretentious introspective AND selflessly loving DOT we can easily forgive that she IS A BIT eccentric AND talks A blue streak FOR her sincere intelligent remarks ARE occasionally penetrating DOT further her varied expressions ARE NOTHING short OF captivating AND she speaks english WITH A french accent that IS very endearing DOT br br IF there IS A fly IN the ointment OF this good movie it would have TO be her unkempt AND disheveled costar DOT ethan hawke AS jessie comes OFF LIKE A vaguely appealing slob sort OF A maynard G DOT krebs OF the nineties DOT attempting TO appear detached AND nonchalant he sort OF drags himself through certain shots DOT his pants fit poorly his tee shirt IS coming untucked his wavy dark hair his most attractive feature needs A good washing AND someone really should have showed him how TO properly TRIM his youthful goatee DOT nevertheless he IS supposed TO represent an unwashed youth ON A two week train ride around europe so the look he has cultivated IS probably pretty genuine DOT his oft cynical observations AND wry sense OF humor seem TO impress the unapologetically romantic celine although she IS occasionally disturbed BY the extent OF his alienation DOT WHEN he finally admits TO her that he IS utterly sick OF himself AND likes being near her because he feels LIKE A different person IN her presence we know he IS getting somewhere DOT br br AFTER blowing their collective funds ON A series OF cafes bars AND silly diversions they agree that because they may never see one another again they should make the most OF it DOT jesse bums A bottle OF red wine OFF A sentimental bartender so that he AND his newfound lady love may repair TO A LOCAL park IN the middle OF the night TO lie ON the grass looking up AT the moon AND the stars AND watching the sun come up DOT br br given his boundless luck IN the romance department it IS especially irksome WHEN jessie AS the very definition OF A naive jerk foolishly allows this wonderful young lady TO slip FROM his grasp DOT he contents himself WITH A half baked plan quickly devised AT the railroad station WHEN he bids her adieu TO reunite AT the same spot IN half A YEAR DOT WHEN the appointed TIME comes you just know this beautiful AND unusual girl will be involved WITH another perhaps even married AND pregnant DOT FOR whatever reason she probably won T SHOW WHILE jesse who ends up working AT target OR IF he s lucky the LOCAL LIBRARY will GO back TO vienna desperate TO see her again ONLY TO wind up alone DOT br br despite what FOR me was A very discouraging conclusion BEFORE sunrise IS A beautiful movie DOT i highly recommend BOTH it AND the sequel BEFORE sunset DOT

text: WHEN i saw this movie IN the theater WHEN it came OUT IN via A FREE advanced screening i was totally enchanted AND would have gladly paid TO see it DOT i was sorry WHEN i talked TO many people ending AND i don T want TO be A spoiler i am totally CONTENT because i know IN my heart that these two CHARACTERS will see EACH other again DOT it s ALL about your own personal faith IN romance AND destiny DOT it s A very personal film that doesn T speak TO ALL people DOT but it certainly spoke TO me DOT give it A chance be patient WITH it richard linklater has crafted A very lovely film WITH A text: BEFORE sunrise has many remarkable things going ON almost too many TO fit INTO one review LIKE this but it s suffice TO say that it s one OF the most observant CHARACTER studies OF the nineties maybe even IN ALL OF contemporary cinema TO be observant NOT about love per say so much AS it s about A human CONNECTION DOT how does one fall IN love AT FIRST sight NO one does AT LEAST that s deep down the consensus that linklater wants TO SHOW WITH his film DOT AND yet there IS the possibility OF AS intense A CONNECTION OF A bond that can form IN those that ARE young AND WITH many ideas that can be expressed articulately AND WITH A BREADTH OF cynicism AND IS somehow very tender AND TRUE AT the same TIME DOT linklater here gives us the story OF celine AND jessie A french girl AND an american boy who GET OFF the same train heading TO vienna AND ON the way there START TO talking about things AT FIRST arbitrary THEN personal jessie seeing death FOR the FIRST TIME IN his great grandfather DOT jessie persuades celine TO GO along WITH him ON A night OUT ON the town IN vienna UNTIL his plane the NEXT morning DOT br br BEFORE sunrise gives jessie AND celine IN the midst OF the gorgeous vienna scenery AND locales TO GO ON AND ON about subjects that have A lot OF importance AND IN A sense IS about the act OF HAVING conversations OF what it s LIKE TO watch people HAVING one LEADING INTO another AND another DOT here it s often about relationships AND commitments AS jessie AND celine tell stories sometimes somewhat inconsequential OR seemingly so AND another that may tell A lot about their essential qualities DOT we hear confessions OF desires FOR other loves OR what weren T really loves OF being part OF A FAMILY OR part OF an upbringing that may OR may NOT inform how you ll love your life OF what it means TO believe OR NOT believe IN SOME religious form OR just TO have SOME CONNECTION TO ANY faith AND the soul i loved the BIT about the quakers IN the church AND sometimes laced WITH cynicism OR skepticism DOT jessie may be MORE responsible FOR that LAST part but what s fascinating about the film IS that it s never exactly cynical itself just commenting upon cynicism that lays IN the concerns OF men AND women AT that age OF their lives DOT br br meanwhile it s ALWAYS great TO see ethan hawke AND julie delpy IN these roles WHERE they re NOT incessantly annoying IN that s generation x MODE but ARE the kinds OF people WHERE IF NOT IN the central conceit OF the film which isn T A bad one AT ALL but A necessary one one might think TO find walking along the streets OF A city somewhere DOT the conceit IS that OF an OLD romantic picture ala brief encounter ONLY here intimacy IS expressed IN the central CHARACTERS either BETWEEN EACH other WHERE sweet asides ARE actually acceptable i have TO tell you A secret jessie says AND THEN leans IN FOR A kiss ho ho OR IN the little moments that pop up WITH other people along the way DOT i loved the scene WITH the poet WHERE it s very cinematic A thing TO suddenly find A random romantic BIT player IN the midst OF A romantic picture WITH such beautiful words AT his disposal OR WITH the palm reader AND how the reactions FROM jessie AND celine ARE that we might SHARE but really ARE seeing them DO it FIRST hand DOT ALL the WHILE hawke AND delpy embody the roles interestingly we can see how neuroses ARE being formed already FOR their adult lives AS it may LEAD OFF INTO the future DOT DOT DOT br br featuring splendid cinematography AND A script WITH an ear FOR NATURAL wit AND A TRUE sense OF what it means TO have A moment OF happiness however SELF contained AS it may LEAD INTO something MORE DOT who s TO say you can T suddenly be attached TO someone IF ONLY FOR less than hours AND be that much MORE attached than A married couple this IS perhaps linklater s thesis but there s MORE TO it than just that DOT it s A very dense film AND one that will have me calling back TO it repeatedly DOT one text: this IS NOT A film you can really ANALYSE separately FROM it s production DOT the audience became the film makers TO an extent unprecedented IN the history OF the american film industry we felt maker who promotes himself AS the audience s friend giving them ALL the naughty treats that the nannyish critics would deny them DOT just look AT that prime SELF publicist eli roth promising gore hounds ALL the viscera missing FROM literally gutless mainstream horror films ONLY TO churn OUT A watered down AND technically incompetent piece OF WORK LIKE hostel DOT br br david r DOT ellis may NOT have spawned the monster that was the internet response TO his film but he was quite understandably quick TO engage WITH it DOT he took the carnival huckster school OF film making TO A NEW LEVEL getting the fans TO build what they would eventually buy DOT so many have enthused OVER this interactive democratic approach TO film making that they seem TO have missed the point that this IS the most cynical form OF film AS marketing DOT NOTHING IS included that the film makers know the fans won T buy AND ANY OLD suggestion that will GET bums ON seats IS incorporated DOT the fact that the pitch became the title tells you ALL you need TO know DOT br br isn T this just the evolution OF the focus GROUP approach individual creativity talent craft ideas ALL ARE sacrificed BEFORE the inane chatter OF the masses DOT it s A critical commonplace that focus GROUPS AND test screenings don T make FOR good movies why should the preemptive intervention OF internet enthusiasts be ANY different CHARACTERS ARE TO be expected but the total lack OF suspense isn T DOT what s the point OF A film that combines two great phobias IF there s NO creeping menace there ARE several snake jumps OUT suspense SEQUENCES were scary AND it wasn T devised BY committee DOT that the CHARACTERS had A little DEPTH AND shading was an unexpected bonus DOT i don T need A post pub midnight showing TO have A good TIME WITH that film DOT br br this film will IN TIME fade TO become A mere footnote IN film history DOT IF it SETS A precedent however i M genuinely worried about what might be crossing our OF humphrey bogart IN BY the academy OF motion picture arts AND science because they chose paul lukas INSTEAD FOR the best actor oscar DOT it does NOT strike me AS totally wrong DOT lukas had A good career IN film BOTH here AND IN england he IS the villain IN the lady vanishes AND this performance was his best one DOT bogart had MORE great performances IN him than rick blaine FOR INSTANCE he was text: BEFORE sunrise IS romance FOR the slacker generation DOT richard linklater s romantic drama IS an offbeat telling OF A dream come TRUE FOR most people DOT the film depicts romance IN ALL it s glory but WITHOUT ANY OF the pitfalls that befall most couples AND IN short the film IS about two people that have A relationship that s AS CLOSE TO perfection AS relationships will ever come TO WITH just one problem the problem OF TIME DOT WHILE most relationships wind down WITH TIME this one keeps going strong throughout AND TIME itself IS the ONLY thing that wears OUT DOT BEFORE sunrise IS certainly NOT the typical sentimental hollywood romance which IS another aspect that puts this film leagues ahead OF the pretenders DOT the story follows two people jesse an american AND celine A french girl that meet ON A train INTO vienna DOT they instantly CONNECT AND AFTER telling her his awful idea FOR A television SHOW AND almost getting OFF the train jesse asks celine TO JOIN him FOR the DAY IN the picturesque city OF vienna DOT DOT DOT br br BEFORE sunrise works principally FOR two reasons realistic acting AND an immense script that builds the CHARACTERS through their thoughts AND feelings AND thus allows us TO GET TO know them AS we DO the people IN REAL life DOT this allows the CHARACTERS TO be FREE AND it s easy TO believe that these ARE REAL people AND NOT just actors working FROM A script DOT this ALSO allows us TO feel FOR the CHARACTERS FOR who they ARE AND NOT merely because they re the protagonists DOT this kind OF realism IS hard TO capture AS AT the END OF the DAY we AS the audience know that they re watching A film AND NOT observing REAL life but BEFORE sunrise represents one OF the truest TO life exhibitions OF realism ever TO be seen ON screen DOT A truly great script cannot WORK ON it s own AND needs great actors TO deliver it TO an extent that does it justice AND although i M NOT A fan OF either julie deply OR ethan hawke ON viewing this film there IS NOTHING you can DO but give them BOTH RESPECT DOT i don T know whether they were IN CHARACTER OR just playing themselves but WHEN A film IS this good it hardly matters DOT br br IN A film LIKE this it IS the writing that s the most important thing AND contained WITHIN the script ARE several observations about life most OF which i personally could relate TO DOT this represents what richard linklater has achieved WITH this script AS NOT ONLY does it CREATE AND build the CHARACTERS but it ALSO manages TO expose what TRUE love IS along WITH several other aspects OF life DOT the fact that NOT ALL the anecdotes ARE relatable TO me personally again represents the brilliance OF writing DOT everyone IS different AND so different parts OF the script will appeal TO different people DOT there could be certain aspects about one person that one person loves AND another hates AND that s the CASE WITH the musings IN this script DOT adding TO the beauty OF the film IS the city OF vienna DOT the city itself isn T really important TO the film AS this IS A story that could have taken place just about anywhere but it makes FOR SOME lovely visuals AND the upbeat energetic romance that blossoms throughout the movie IS MATCHED BY the beauty OF the LOCATION DOT br br BEFORE sunrise IS simultaneously beautiful AND captivating DOT richard linklater has created something that IS rare IN the world OF cinema A film that captures the beauty OF life WITHOUT ever going OVER the top OR being overly sentimental DOT BEFORE sunrise IS what it IS DOT AND what it IS IS pure cinematic brilliance DOT
label: safe

CONTENT i decided TO spend my christmas evening ON watching the movie DOT the effect surprised me totally i DO NOT remember WHEN i LAST saw A film IN which EVERY single moment involved me DOT A vow TO cherish IS WITHOUT ANY doubt one OF the movies that now constitutes A REAL surprise i have received FROM cinema DOT here ARE SOME arguments OF mine why i consider this film A highly underrated piece OF good cinema DOT br br FIRST the entire CONTENT IS particularly educational DOT it has something TO offer TO the modern audience pure RIGHT faith AND SOME answers FOR the universal questions DOT IS there A need FOR christ IN our times does love still matter what FOR IS there faith what IS the logics OF burden AND suffering IN life IS there really someone BY my side i can ALWAYS trust the movie provides the answers through the CONTENT since ALL that happens TO the CHARACTERS may AS well happen TO ANY OF us DOT br br SECOND the movie IS exceptionally humane DOT the main CHARACTERS experience INNER struggles AND cope WITH extremely hard decisions DOT IS it better FOR kyle david denman AND teri megan paul TO START their own lives AND forget about the FAMILY OR retain the VALUES they were taught AT home IS it better FOR john ken howard TO LEAVE ellen barbara babcock his sick wife AND START A NEW happy life WITH julia donna bullock A woman he falls IN love WITH IN fact ellen NO longer recognizes him DOT DOT DOT yet he decides TO vow his wife eternal fidelity DOT had john s rebellious brother phil d DOT david morin better GO ON his easy life although it does NOT bring him
