nevertheless it IS A very educational aspect AND A realistic one DOT br br fourth the entire film focuses ON people s mutual help DOT IF we want TO live happy lives IN our society we must understand one thing we have TO help one another DOT alexander ossie davis IS an example OF such attitude DOT AT the beginning OF the movie we see him talk TO john about praying DOT later he helps his brother DOT alexander IS A kinda angel that IS sent TO john AND his FAMILY DOT isn T it possible that we may become angels TO one another br br fifth the artistic features ARE ALSO worth attention DOT performances barbara babcock gives an authentic performance AS ellen AND although she has A difficult ROLE she does A perfect job DOT consider FOR INSTANCE the moment she appears AT school AND badly wants TO teach again DOT ken howard IS ALSO memorable AS the faithful husband DOT picture the most memorable FOR me was the scene OF john AND ellen IN the park walking ON the fallen leaves autumn WHILE the sunshine love spreads everywhere DOT i interpreted AS A sort OF symbol even IF there IS sorrow this can ALWAYS be illuminated BY light AND joy DOT DOT DOT br br A vow TO cherish IS A wonderful movie that realistically showed TO me what it means TO love what fidelity IS AS well it once again proved TO me how beautiful it IS TO live AND believe DOT AT the END i would LIKE TO QUOTE the profound words FROM the movie i FOUND very touching AND hope you will ALSO DO br br kyle TO his uncle phil YES he john brighton lives ACCORDING TO the bible DOT but nobody forces you TO DO so DOT yet ACCORDING TO what rules DO you live

text: i have absolutely NO knowledge OF author phillipa pearce OR ANY OF her novels AND IF toms midnight garden IS typical OF her WORK i probably would have had little interest IN her books AS A child DOT WHEN i was A child i wasnt really interested IN litreture unless it had soldiers fighting monsters complete WITH A high body COUNT br br judging BY this film VERSION OF toms midnight garden i guess pearce writes FOR LOWER middle CLASS kids since much OF the story OF revolves around protagonist tom LONG moving TO A house WITH NO garden THEN suddenly finding A metaphysical one DOT HAVING A garden OF your own was NO doubt something that working CLASS people didnt have IN the s so i guess theres SOME political CLASS ridden subtext there somewhere DOT theres ALSO A romance involving A young girl CALLED hattie but again ARE cynical kids amoured BY love stories perhaps the worst criticism IS that very little IN the way OF excitement OR adventure happens WITHIN the narrative br br this IS A childrens film that seems dated BY its SOURCE DOT its inoffensive but im surprised BY its high rating BY the imdb voters DOT i wonder how many OF them would have given it so many high marks IF they were YEAR olds whod just seen the lord OF the rings trilogy

text: FOR muslim women IN western africa married life AT the hands OF abusive husbands can be very hard DOT the community may NOT explicitly endorse such behaviour but equally they may NOT yet be ready TO see it AS criminal an attitude which OF course enables it TO CONTINUE DOT fortunately the letter OF the cameroonian law promises equality TO ALL AND this documentary follows the REAL life exploits OF various female practitioners IN the cameroonian legal SYSTEM AS they attempt TO secure justice FOR A NUMBER OF women AND children DOT what IS notable apart FROM the uplifting central story IS how IN spite OF their informality the courts ARE actually pragmatically progressive IF A CASE IS actually bought DOT the PROGRAM ALSO gives A fascinating insight the whole cameroonian life STYLE which aside FROM the awful crimes COMMITTED IN the featured cases seems amazingly emotional AND joyous compared WITH that enjoyed BY inhabitants OF europe OR north america DOT AND WHILE i concede that this COMMENT may betray naivet ON my part this attitude appears TO be captured IN delightful pidgin english they speak DOT overall this IS A terrific little film AND much MORE fun TO watch than you might imagine DOT
label: safe

text: raising victor vargas A review br br you know raising victor vargas IS LIKE sticking your hands INTO A big steaming bowl OF oatmeal DOT it s warm AND gooey but you re NOT sure IF it feels RIGHT DOT try AS i might NO matter how warm AND gooey raising victor vargas became i was ALWAYS aware that something didn T quite feel RIGHT DOT victor vargas suffers FROM A certain overconfidence ON the director s part DOT apparently the director thought that the ethnic backdrop OF A latino FAMILY ON the LOWER east side AND an idyllic storyline would make the film critic proof DOT he was RIGHT but it didn T fool me DOT raising victor vargas IS the story about A seventeen YEAR OLD boy CALLED you guessed it victor vargas victor rasuk who lives his teenage years chasing MORE skirt than the rolling stones could DO IN ALL the years they ve toured DOT the movie starts OFF IN ugly fat donna s bedroom WHERE victor IS sure TO seduce her but A cry FROM outside disrupts his PLANS WHEN his best friend harold kevin rivera comes A looking FOR him DOT caught IN the attempt BY harold AND his sister victor vargas runs OFF FOR damage CONTROL DOT yet even WITH the embarrassing implication that he s been boffing the homeliest girl IN the neighborhood NOTHING dissuades young victor FROM going OFF ON the hunt FOR MORE fresh meat DOT ON A hot NEW york city DAY they make way TO the LOCAL PUBLIC swimming pool WHERE victor s eyes catch A glimpse OF the lovely young nymph judy judy marte who s NOT just pretty but A strong AND independent too DOT the relationship that develops BETWEEN victor AND judy becomes the focus OF the film DOT the story ALSO focuses ON victor s FAMILY that IS comprised OF his grandmother OR abuelita altagracia guzman his brother nino ALSO played BY REAL life brother TO victor silvestre rasuk AND his sister vicky krystal rodriguez DOT the ACTION follows victor BETWEEN scenes WITH judy AND scenes WITH his FAMILY DOT victor tries TO cope WITH being an oversexed pimp daddy his feelings FOR judy AND his grandmother s conservative catholic upbringing DOT br br the problems that arise FROM raising victor vargas ARE A few but glaring errors DOT throughout the film you GET TO know certain CHARACTERS LIKE vicky nino grandma judy AND even judy s best friend melonie DOT the problem IS we know NOTHING OF victor vargas EXCEPT that he IS the biggest gigolo IN the neighborhood DOT we know that he knows how TO lick his lips AND comb his fro AND carry himself FOR the sake OF wooing girls INTO the sack but that s ALL DOT we know that nino plays piano AND quiet well you could see it BY the awards ON the FAMILY piano DOT we know his sister nicki IS A gossip loving girl WITH an invested interest IN watching tv DOT we know that grandma IS A hard working traditional latina woman who s trying TO raise her kids WITH conservatively IN A world OF excess corruption DOT yet WHERE IS the titular CHARACTER victor vargas he s IN this movie somewhere but we ONLY know what the movie tells us DOT this IS BY far the film s biggest flaw DOT victor vargas isn T so much A CHARACTER but A ping pong ball bouncing BETWEEN scenes WITH judy AND his grandmother but we never GET TO know who victor vargas really IS DOT this IS important because AS i ve mentioned the ONLY thing we know OF victor vargas IS that he s A sexually active teenager WITH A libido the SIZE OF manhattan DOT he s A total alpha male DOT victor vargas IS NOT the kind OF CHARACTER i sympathize WITH AT ALL DOT why should anyone so BY the END OF the movie IN the aftermath OF the climax ARE we truly led TO believe that somehow victor vargas has attained ANY DEPTH AND learned the errors OF his ways how could such A two dimensional CHARACTER have ANY DEPTH IF ONLY the director had worried A little MORE about fleshing OUT his main CHARACTER INSTEAD OF worrying about getting that perfect hand held shot DOT br br raising victor vargas brings TO life the world OF the latino INNER city neighborhood TO the big screen DOT something that few films have done BEFORE IN the past DOT the film has been complimented FOR feeling so REAL AND i won T br br argue WITH that DOT i haven T seen this LEVEL OF reality since cbs aired survivor DOT seriously although the movie has SOME nice shots OF the city the writer director peter sollett was way too dependent ON CLOSE ups AND hand held shots DOT this problem IS particularly noticed IN indoor scenes that ARE so claustrophobic i was forced TO perform deep breathing exercises TO keep FROM PASSING OUT DOT AS the film continues the shots GET tighter AND tighter WITH faces cropped FROM brow TO chin ON the screen you can practically smell victor vargas s cheap cologne DOT the overall effect IS unrealistic IN contrast DOT the indoor scenes OF INNER city apartments make them look small AND cramp which IS NOT TRUE DOT i ve been IN those TYPE apartments i used TO live IN one DOT they re NOT splendorous but they have high ceilings AND they re decent living spaces DOT BY the movie s standards you d think that these apartments were x cells OF brick AND mortar chipped paint AND cracked walls DOT unfortunately sollett s constant USE OF CLOSE ups AND one particularly bad shot WITH A zoom IN ON one scene come OFF AS totally amateurish DOT but raising victor vargas IS ONLY sollett s SECOND film AND his most well known A solid effort IN filmmaking that will hopefully GET better AS he continues TO make films DOT one review i READ summarized the movie AS ethnicity FOR ethnicity s sake AND i cannot agree MORE DOT IF victor vargas were truly A great film AND story THEN the CHARACTERS applicability wouldn T matter whether they were latino chinese etc DOT yet IF you were TO take this story AND stick it IN middle CLASS suburbia WITH A bunch OF teeny bopper white kids the results wouldn T be such glowing reviews AND we d see the film s flaws MORE clearly DOT indeed SOME other aspects OF the USE OF latinos IN this film bother me DOT WHILE SOME aspects OF victor vargas ARE accurate OTHERS i have TO question DOT FOR example victor nino AND vicky ALL SHARE the same room TO sleep DOT this SET OFF an alarm FOR me because it seemed contrary TO what i believe DOT ANY SELF respecting latino FAMILY wouldn T have two older brothers sharing the same room WITH A thirteen YEAR OLD girl DOT AT FIRST i was unsure perhaps i was wrong but AFTER speaking WITH my grandmother i knew my problem WITH this was justified DOT considering how conservative the grandmother IS you d think that vicky would have been sleeping IN her room DOT br br AS A latino who grew up IN A somewhat conservative cuban household raised BY my grandmother WHILE my mother was working FULL TIME i could relate TO the movie IN many ways which IS why my critical viewpoints ARE bittersweet because i really wanted TO love this movie DOT unfortunately my lack OF RESPECT FOR victor vargas sabotaged my feelings FOR the film DOT maybe it s because victor vargas reminds me OF those guys who were getting laid WHILE i was playing WITH my sega genesis WHEN i was seventeen DOT maybe it s because WITHOUT ANY further introspection BY the film victor vargas IS merely A stereotypical hot blooded latino who ll just END up shouting TO girls FROM his car hey bay bee ju want TO GET INTO my luv mah cheen either way i don T LIKE him so ultimately how can i LIKE A film about him so IF you ll excuse me i M going TO GO stick my hands INTO A bowl OF grits DOT br br
label: safe

text: i notice that the previous reviewer who appears TO be still AT school gave this movie A very good review AND i can ONLY assume that this IS because the reviewer hasn T seen the far superior bbc adaptation OF this classic novel DOT the major problem i had WITH this VERSION was the casting OF anthony way AS tom LONG DOT anthony way was A talented boy treble who shot TO fame AFTER appearing IN the tv mini series the choir DOT i can ONLY assume that he was CAST FOR the ROLE OF tom LONG ON the strength OF his excellent acting IN the choir DOT unfortunately the small boy who appeared IN the choir had grown INTO A tall AND gangly youth BY the TIME tom s midnight garden was filmed AND AS such anthony fails TO convince AS schoolboy tom DOT it IS too far A stretch OF the imagination TO believe that tom AS played BY anthony would befriend the far younger hatty DOT IN the bbc VERSION tom AND hatty ARE much closer IN age AND the development OF their friendship IS so much MORE believable DOT FOR A movie even the special effects fail TO convince AND ARE NOT ANY noticeable improvement ON the tv effects DOT the casting AND acting OF this VERSION ARE inferior TO the earlier adaptation AND ALL IN ALL the movie was A lack lustre VERSION OF A TRUE classic DOT AS A FINAL observation i would point OUT that the vhs OF the bbc VERSION fetches well OVER DOT SECOND hand whereas A NEW dvd OF this VERSION can be bought FOR UNDER DOT need i say MORE

minutes

text: SOME people say steve irwin s larrikin antics AND gregarious personality ARE ONLY an act DOT watch this film it s obvious he can T act DOT br br steve irwin dangerman star OF the small screen IN his crocodile hunter diaries croc files AND eponymous crocodile hunter series you see A naming trend here OR IS it just me rockets his larger than strife persona TO the big screen WITH crocodile hunter collision course yup there s A definite trend OF words beginning WITH C basically an episode OF crocodile hunter mashed together WITH A b movie DOT br br ON A mission TO relocate A big croc TO save it FROM being shot BY an eccentric farmer magda szubanski steve AND wife terri ARE unaware that the croc IS being tracked BY american spies lachy hulme AND kenneth ransom OUT TO recover A spy satellite beacon it has swallowed DOT will it hurt my credibility TO say they re ON A collision course WITH wackiness what credibility ed note DOT br br the plot IS irrelevant AS it IS steve s animal magnetism that propels the film DOT IF you find his persona trying the film IS A failure but IF you re A fan OF either him AS A businessman conservationist OR just plain ass klown OR his television shows expect MORE OF the same ON A wide screen budget DOT br br john stainton faithful liege best mate AND helmer OF the crocodile hunter oeuvre can it be CALLED that WITH A straight face writes AND directs WITH the same provincial swagger that made steve A household wildlife jester DOT br br the most jarring aspect OF this movie IS that steve one OF the few people FOR whom you can actually hear the exclamation points going BY AS he speaks AND terri steve s spouse OF years fiercest ally AND closest friend TREAT it LIKE it IS one OF their documentaries breaking the fourth wall AND speaking directly TO the camera whilst ALL the other CHARACTERS behave AS IF they re IN A bad movie well DOT it wouldn T be so incongruous IF steve AND terri were kept separated FROM the rest OF the CHARACTERS but WHEN the bad americans constantly threaten steve s life we confused viewers must ask ourselves why the indifferent camera crew doesn T AT LEAST CALL the cops IF NOT try TO poke the bad guys IN the eye WITH the boom mics OR run screaming INTO the bush anything but CONTINUE filming casually WITH great lighting crisp audio AND seven ACTION angles DOT br br WHILE terri IS unfairly painted AS steve s mildly incompetent sidekick her acting consists OF boldly inept line READS AND gadding about IN pear shaped buttock hugging jeans FOR the LAST i M NOT complaining steve goes about his business AS usual OF SHOW AND tell WITH creatures intent ON killing him doing ALL his stunts himself because well TO him they re NOT really stunts just A DAY AT the office DOT br br OF course watching this madman s koo koo adventures AFTER his tragic death IN september casts A strange detachment OVER the proceedings DOT but TO those OF us who never met him this kind OF malarkey AS well AS various incarnations OF the crocodile hunter series IN constant re runs keeps him AS alive AS ever IN our crocodile burrows DOT the wrenching reality OF his absence will ONLY be apparent TO those nearest him DOT AND i truly wish them the best IN FOLLOWING IN his outsize footprints br br so enjoy this diversion FOR what it IS A half baked movie featuring A FULL ON legend DOT he died doing what he loved interacting WITH wildlife AND he could never have asked FOR MORE OF his FIRST feature film IN portraying him doing just that DOT br br movie maniacs visit poffysmoviemania DOT com
label: safe

text: WHEN teenagers GO ON A trip IN A camper van there ARE many clichs that you can guarantee will follow DOT br br the teenagers will be warned NOT TO GO WHERE they ARE going BY A crazy LOCAL DOT dan van husen handles that WITH ridiculous exposition about deadly sirens DOT what who how AND why ARE handled IN one almost unintelligible burst DOT the van will break down DOT whilst looking FOR help the GROUP will be split up AND be picked OFF one BY one BY whatever monster they have been warned about DOT they will find A house inhabited BY A madman he will capture them DOT the house will have A phone but it will NOT WORK it will be disturbingly decorated there will be flickering neon light spiders AND maggots DOT the madman will catch them AS they try TO ESCAPE IN A vehicle that won T START here the high speed getaway was TO be made ON A tractor DOT the madman will be seemingly killed ONLY TO come back FROM the dead FOR A cheap weak scare AND will THEN be killed properly DOT ONLY A girl will be LEFT alive FROM the GROUP DOT there will be an unnecessary twist AT the END DOT br br ADD TO these elements naked sirens who the CHARACTERS seem TO react TO IN startling different ways despite the fact that everyone that sees them IS supposed TO fall INTO lust WITH them IMMEDIATELY that seduce AND kill the teens throats being ripped OUT AND bodies being pulled IN half AND you have something resembling A twelve YEAR OLD boys dream movie DOT br br i think it IS ONLY fair TO say that my opinion OF the director AND his previous WORK IS AS low AS it IS possible TO be but i am happy TO point OUT that there ARE A few elements that boarder ON pleasurable AND ARE A great improvement ON his previous film darkhunters which IS one OF the worst films i have ever seen DOT AT times the cinematography IS very good the music AND editing ARE A cut above his previous films AND SOME other low budget horror movies DOT i was impressed TO hear that it was achieved WITH A third OF the money spent ON the previous monstrosity DOT however the worst things about this movie ARE NOT TO be FOUND IN the body OF the film it IS ultimately A mildly diverting IF pointless movie that has been done TIME AND TIME again but amongst the dvd extras DOT br br IF you DO rent this film i implore you TO LISTEN TO the director s commentary it IS beyond belief DOT there IS MORE TO say about this than the film itself DOT one staggering part OF the commentary IS the director s claim that the film IS clich leaden because it was A preconceived idea DOT he says it IS A deliberate attempt TO USE ALL OF the clichs AND openly he wonders IF people will GET it DOT br br i M afraid TO say that IF this IS supposed TO be A clever nod AND A wink TO films OF the past AND the genre clichs WITHIN them THEN it IS NOT wittily scripted enough acted IN an appropriate tone nor directed WITH enough STYLE TO WORK DOT IF this film was made TO ORDER it leads me TO ask one question what was the point this IS s afilm that just slips RIGHT INTO the canon OF bad horror movies ANY attempt TO DO something clever OR different haven T worked DOT br br the NEXT nugget OF brilliance IS A conversation about the snobbery towards digital film formats DOT they rightly point OUT that digital IS often synonymous WITH cheapness AND ease OF USE DOT however the best moment OF the conversation comes WHEN they bemoan the fact that WHEN michael mann makes A film IN the format he IS branded AS A visionary DOT there IS A SIMPLE distinction TO be made here mann IS A talented director who will USE the format TO fit his story AND STYLE roberts IS A horror hack who uses it TO produce bottom shelf genre pictures DOT i think the differences ARE obvious AND the comparison IS NOT ONLY arrogant but redundant DOT br br the best moment IS reserved FOR robert s COMMENTS about people who have taken the TIME TO review his previous film DOT those who didn T LIKE it ARE generalised AS geeks AND he even goes AS far AS TO single OUT SPECIFIC people FOR HAVING the nerve TO voice their opinion IN forums that encourage them TO DO just that DOT i must admit i was slightly disappointed that my review OF his LAST film wasn T singled OUT FOR ridicule DOT the tirade goes further AS the GROUP joke about norwegian reviewers complete WITH hilarious accents TO imply that people FROM norway wouldn T know A good film simply because OF WHERE they ARE born DOT AS ALWAYS these sorts OF COMMENTS say MORE about those saying them than those they ARE targeting they simply make the director AND his friends look ignorant DOT br br the package IN rounded OUT WITH A tasteful featurette about how the sirens were CAST DOT robert s swears blind IN voice OVER i didn T want TO make A film that was LIKE baywatch AS we see audition tapes OF topless AND naked girls writhing around ON the ground DOT there IS ALSO A simpering SELF indulgent documentary about the making OF darkhunters during which robert s says that A reviewer has claimed that forest IS the best british film IN years DOT i don T know who he IS trying TO convince DOT AT one point IN the commentary track robert s says jokingly i can see people sitting AT home saying this isn T amazing its sht he isn T wrong DOT
label: safe

text: emma IS A horribly flawed film based ON jane austens classic novel DOT i have NOT READ the book so i really didn T know that much about the plot AND yet i still predicted nearly the entire plot DOT there were ALSO many scenes that frustrated me because OF the bad writing OR directing DOT the film IS though FOR SOME reason very entertaining AND i loved it DOT OF course there were ALL the scenes i disliked but the majority was well acted AND funny DOT gwyneth paltrow gives one OF her best performances AS the heroine IN emma DOT the film ALSO stars toni collette who has okay but has been much better ewan mecgreger who has ALSO been better but he IS still very good here alan cumming who i have never really been impressed WITH AND IS pretty much the same here AND jeremy northam who s performance IS rather wooden AT FIRST look but actually fairly subtle even IF that was NOT what it needed there have been much better adaptations OF jane austen books but this one IS still very entertaining AND worth watching DOT

text: emma was A product OF what might be CALLED BY the FIRST great jane austen CYCLE OF the mid nineties AND it was recently shown ON british television doubtless because OF the interest IN the author created BY the SECOND great jane austen CYCLE which started WITH pride AND prejudice two years ago DOT we currently have IN the cinemas the austen biopic becoming jane AND itv have recently produced three tv movies based ON austen novels DOT these include northanger abbey the ONLY one OF the six major novels NOT TO have been filmed previously so the CYCLE should now be complete DOT NO doubt however there will be MORE TO come IN the near future DOT there IS AFTER ALL her juvenile love AND freindship sic the short novella lady susan AND someone somewhere has doubtless supplied endings TO her two unfinished fragments the watsons AND sanditon DOT THEN there ARE ALL those austen sequels churned OUT BY modern writers DOT br br the main CHARACTER IS emma woodhouse A young lady FROM an aristocratic FAMILY IN regency england DOT NOT AS SOME reviewers have assumed victorian england austen died BEFORE queen victoria was even born DOT emma IS financially considerably better OFF than most austen heroines such AS elizabeth bennett OR fanny price AND has NO need TO find herself A wealthy husband DOT INSTEAD her main preoccupation seems TO be finding husbands FOR her friends DOT she persuades her friend harriet TO turn down A proposal OF marriage FROM A young farmer robert martin believing that harriet should be setting her sights ON the ambitious clergyman mr elton DOT this scheme goes disastrously wrong however AS elton has NO interest IN harriet but has fallen IN love WITH emma herself DOT the speed WITH which emma rejects his proposal makes one wonder just why she was so keen TO MATCH her friend WITH A man she regards WITH good reason AS an unsuitable marriage partner FOR herself DOT this being A jane austen plot emma turns OUT TO be less OF A COMMITTED spinster than she seems AND she too finds herself falling IN love LEADING TO further complications DOT br br emma ALWAYS insists that she will NOT marry WITHOUT affection AND WHEN she does find A partner the handsome mr knightley we feel that this will indeed be an affectionate marriage DOT it does NOT however seem likely TO be A very passionate one unlike say that OF elizabeth bennett AND mr darcy DOT knightley who IS sixteen years older than emma she IS he AND related TO her BY marriage IS MORE LIKE A father figure than A lover DOT much MORE OF A father figure IN fact than her actual father A querulous AND selfish OLD hypochondriac who seems MORE LIKE her grandfather DOT WHEN emma IS rude TO her unbearably garrulous AND tedious friend miss bates it IS knightley who chides her FOR her lack OF manners DOT his surname IS probably meant TO indicate his gentlemanly nature nineteenth century gentlemen liked TO think OF themselves AS the modern equivalent OF mediaeval knights WITH their elaborate codes OF chivalry DOT BOTH gwyneth paltrow AND jeremy northam play their parts very well but this IS NOT really one OF the great screen romances DOT br br OF the other CHARACTERS i liked juliet stephenson s vulgar mrs elton AND toni collette s harriet DOT i know that IN the novel harriet was A nave young teenager whereas here she IS MORE LIKE the CHARACTER collette played IN muriel s wedding A gauche slightly overweight twentysomething fretting about her chances OF finding A man DOT nevertheless i felt that this characterisation worked well IN the context OF the film AND did NOT detract FROM austen s themes DOT br br emma IS one OF austen s MORE light hearted works WITHOUT the darker overtones OF mansfield park OR even pride AND prejudice AND this IS reflected ON screen DOT we see A world OF beauty AND grace FULL OF stately homes AND elegant costumes AND fine manners DOT apart FROM the ruffianly gypsies who make A very brief appearance the ONLY poor people we see ARE mrs bates AND her daughter AND AS they live IN the sort OF picturesque rose strewn thatched cottage which today would change hands FOR OVER we can be sure that their poverty IS RELATIVE NOT ABSOLUTE DOT IN emma s world poverty IS DEFINED AS NOT HAVING your own stately home DOT this IS OF course NOT A comprehensive picture OF early nineteenth century life but nobody has ever claimed austen AS the regency equivalent OF A kitchen sink realist DOT sophisticated romantic comedy combined WITH A keen eye FOR analysing human CHARACTER was MORE IN her line DOT br br i would NOT rate this film quite AS highly AS the sense AND sensibility OR the recent pride AND prejudice it tends TO drag A BIT IN the middle although it has A strong beginning AND strong ending but it IS IN the main A highly enjoyable austen adaptation DOT
label: safe

text: forest OF the damned starts OUT AS five young friends brother sister emilio richard cambridge ally sophie holland along WITH judd daniel maclagan molly nicole petty andrew david hood SET OFF ON A week LONG holiday IN the middle OF nowhere their words NOT mine DOT anyway BEFORE they know it they re deep IN A forest emilio clumsily runs OVER A woman frances da costa along WITH A badly injured person TO ADD TO their problems the van they re travelling IN won T START they can T GET ANY signals ON their mobile phones DOT they need TO find help quickly so molly judd wander OFF IN the hope OF finding A house AS TIME goes BY darkness begins TO fall it becomes clear that they ARE NOT alone that there IS something nasty lurking IN the woods DOT DOT DOT br br this english production was written directed BY johannes roberts HAVING looked OVER several other COMMENTS reviews BOTH here ON the imdb across the internet forest OF the damned seems TO divide opinion WITH SOME liking it other s NOT personally it didn T DO much FOR AT ALL DOT the script IS credited ON screen TO roberts but here ON the imdb it lists joseph london WITH additional screenplay material whatever that means the film IS your basic backwoods slasher TYPE thing LIKE the texas chainsaw massacre WITH your basic stranded faceless teenage victims being bumped OFF but uses the interesting concept OF fallen angels who roam the forest kill people FOR reason that ARE never explained TO ANY great deal OF satisfaction DOT THEN there s stephen played BY the ever fantastic tom savini who IS never given ANY sort OF justification FOR what he does DOT IS he there TO GET victims FOR the angels IF so why did he kill andrew BY bashing his head IN the story IS very loose it never felt LIKE A proper film DOT the CHARACTER s ARE poor the dialogue NOT much better the lack OF ANY significant story makes it hard TO GET INTO it OR care about anything that s going ON DOT HAVING said that it moves along AT A reasonable pace there ARE A couple OF decent scenes here DOT br br director johannes doesn T DO anything special it s NOT A particularly stylish OR flash film TO look AT DOT there s A few decent horror scenes the tom savini CHARACTER IS great WHENEVER he s ON screen although why didn T he hear judd breaking the door down WITH an axe WHILE escaping WITH molly it s A shame WHEN he gets killed OFF DOT there ARE A couple OF decent gore scenes here someone has their head bashed IN there s A decapitation someone gets shotgun blasted someone throat IS bitten OUT someones lips ARE bitten OFF someone IS ripped IN half DOT there IS ALSO A fair amount OF FULL frontal female nudity NOT that it helps much DOT br br technically forest OF the damned IS ok it s reasonably well made but NOTHING overly special OR eye catching DOT this was shot IN england wales it s quite odd TO see an english setting FOR A very american themed backwards horror DOT the acting IS generally pretty poor save FOR savini who deserves TO be IN better than this DOT horror author shaun hutson has an embarrassing cameo AT the END proves he should stick TO writing rather than acting DOT br br forest OF the damned was A pretty poor horror film it seems TO have fans OUT there so maybe i M missing something but it s NOT A film i have much fondness FOR DOT apart FROM one OR two decent moments there s NOT much here TO recommend DOT
label: safe

text: this film actually works FROM A fairly original idea i ve never seen nymphs that were thrown OUT OF heaven IN A horror movie BEFORE anyway DOT however the way that it executes this idea isn T original IN the slightest we follow A bunch OF kids that FOR SOME reason decide TO GO ON A trip INTO the forest DOT the fact that the forest IS inhabited BY these nymphs make it MORE interesting than merely another forest filled BY rednecks nutcases zombies etc but really the monsters ARE just A variation ON the common horror IN the woods theme DOT many films OF this ilk don T have A single good idea AND it would seem that this one has worn its brain cells OUT WITH just that one DOT the ONLY REAL asset that the monsters bring TO the TABLE IS the fact that they re beautiful women that the CHARACTERS lust FOR rather than being hideous grotesques that they want TO run away FROM DOT this IS good up UNTIL A point but it soon gets boring AND the almost complete lack OF ANY back story surrounding the central monsters ensures that the film IS never going GET itself OUT OF the horror trash category DOT br br it s been years since the evil dead made the woodlands A prime horror LOCATION AND IN spite OF films LIKE the blair witch project it still makes FOR an excellent horror setting DOT this IS one OF the film s major assets AS the forest presents A good impression OF the UNKNOWN the ONLY problem IS that forest OF the damned doesn T ever seem TO have much up its sleeve DOT the death SEQUENCES SHOW A DISTINCT lack OF imagination AND the fact that ALL the CHARACTERS ARE clichd IN the extreme doesn T help AS you re MORE likely TO be looking FORWARD TO seeing them GET killed rather than hoping they can GET away DOT the CAST IS made up OF kids mainly but there IS A ROLE here FOR tom savini who unfortunately doesn T GET TO have fun IN the special effects department DOT the ONLY REAL highlight the film has WHERE personnel ARE concerned comes FROM the nymphs themselves DOT the naked ladies tend TO look great AND IF it wasn T FOR them this film would GET very boring very quickly DOT there s NOTHING TO recommend this film FOR really but IF you want A daft little horror film that harks back TO the STYLE OF eighties woodland flicks you might find SOME enjoyment here DOT
label: safe

text: romance IS IN the air AND love IS IN bloom IN victorian era england IN this light hearted story SET against A society IN A TIME IN which manners were still IN vogue the ladies were charming AND elegant AND the gentlemen dashing DOT emma based ON the novel BY jane austen AND written FOR the screen AND directed BY douglas mcgrath stars the lovely gwyneth paltrow IN the title ROLE DOT A SELF appointed matchmaker emma takes great delight IN the romantic notion OF playing cupid AND attempting TO pair up those she feels ARE suited TO one another DOT coming OFF A successful matching that ended IN marriage she NEXT SETS her sights ON finding A mate FOR her friend harriet toni collette but the outcome OF her initial attempt proves TO be less than satisfying DOT meanwhile her endeavors ARE tempered BY BY the handsome mr DOT knightley jeremy northam whose insights INTO matters OF the heart often seem TO be A BIT MORE astute than emma s AND lend SOME needed balance TO the proceedings DOT AND emma so concerned WITH what IS RIGHT FOR OTHERS neglects the heart that IS actually the most important OF ALL her own DOT the world goes round AND love abounds but emma IS about TO miss the boat DOT luckily FOR her however the IS someone just RIGHT FOR her waiting IN the wings DOT now IF she can but stop LONG enough TO realize it DOT but AS everyone who has known TRUE love knows matters OF the heart can GO RIGHT OR wrong IN an instant depending upon the slightest thing AND WHILE romance IS AT hand FOR emma she must FIRST recognize it AND seize the moment DOT br br mcgrath has crafted AND delivered A delightful feel good film that IS LIKE A breath OF fresh air IN our often turbulent world DOT there may be an air OF frivolity about it but IN retrospect this story deals WITH something that IS perhaps the most important thing there IS IN ALL honesty TO just about anyone love DOT AND WITH mcgrath s impeccable sense OF pace AND timing it ALL plays OUT here IN A way that IS entirely entertaining AND enjoyable DOT it s A pleasant affecting film WITH A wonderful CAST that successfully transports the viewer TO another TIME AND another place DOT it s light fare but absorbing AND the picturesque settings AND proceedings offer A sense OF well being AND calm that allows you TO immerse yourself IN it AND simply GO WITH the flow DOT br br the winsome paltrow who won the oscar FOR best actress FOR shakespeare IN love two years AFTER making this one seems comfortable AND RIGHT AT home IN this genre DOT she personifies ALL things british AND does it WITH such naturalness AND facility that it s the kind OF performance that IS easily taken FOR GRANTED OR overlooked altogether DOT she s simply so good AT what she does AND makes it look so easy DOT she has A charismatic screen presence AND an endearing manner very reminiscent OF audrey hepburn DOT yet paltrow IS UNIQUE DOT AS an actor she has A wide RANGE AND STYLE AND has demonstrated WITH such films AS hard eight hush AND A perfect murder that she can play just about ANY part effectively AND WITH that personal touch that makes ANY ROLE she plays her own DOT but it s WITH CHARACTERS LIKE emma that she really shines DOT she IS so expressive AND OPEN AND her personality IS so engaging that she IS someone TO whom it IS easy TO relate AND just A joy TO watch regardless OF the part she IS playing DOT AND FOR emma she IS absolutely perfect DOT br br jeremy northam ALSO acquits himself extremely well IN the ROLE OF knightley AND LIKE paltrow seems suited TO the genre IN the RIGHT ROLE that IS his performance IN the MORE recent the golden bowl IN which he played an italian prince was less than satisfying DOT here however he IS perfect he IS handsome AND carries himself IN such A way that makes knightley believable AND very REAL DOT LIKE colin firth s mr DOT darcy IN the miniseries pride AND prejudice northam has created A memorable CHARACTER WITH his own mr DOT knightley DOT br br ALSO excellent IN supporting roles AND worthy OF mention ARE toni collette AS emma s friend harriet smith AND alan cumming AS the reverend elton DOT respectively collette AND cumming CREATE CHARACTERS who ARE very REAL people AND AS such become A vital asset TO the overall success OF this film DOT AND it demonstrates just how invaluable the supporting players ARE IN the world OF the cinema AND TO films OF ANY genre DOT br br the supporting CAST includes greta scacchi mrs DOT weston denys hawthorne mr DOT woodhouse sophie thompson miss bates kathleen byron mrs DOT goddard phyllida law mrs DOT bates polly walker jane fairfax AND ewan mcgregor frank churchill DOT an uplifting elegant film emma IS A reminder OF civilized behavior AND the VALUE OF gentleness AND grace IN A world too often beset WITH unpleasantness DOT AND even IF it s ONLY through the magic OF the silver screen it s nice TO be able TO ESCAPE TO such A world AS this IF ONLY FOR A couple OF hours AS it fulfills the need FOR that renewal OF faith IN the human spirit DOT AND that s the magic OF the movies DOT i rate this one DOT br br br br
label: safe

text: A remarkable documentary about the landmark achievements OF the women lawyers association wla OF kumba IN southwest cameroon IN legally safeguarding the rights OF women AND children FROM acts OF domestic violence DOT IN this muslim culture WHERE men have ALWAYS been sovereign OVER women ACCORDING TO sharia law one can well imagine the difficulty OF imposing secular legal rights FOR women AND children DOT AFTER years OF failed efforts leaders OF the wla began recently TO score A few wins AND the purpose OF this film IS TO SHARE these victorious stories DOT br br the leaders OF this legal reform movement ARE vera ngassa A STATE prosecutor AND beatrice ntuba A senior judge court president DOT BOTH play themselves IN this film which may contain footage shot spontaneously though i imagine much OF it IF NOT ALL consists OF subsequent recreations OF REAL events FOR the camera DOT four cases ARE reviewed AND ALL OF the plaintiffs ALSO play themselves IN the film DOT br br two cases involve repeated wife beating WITH forcible sex IN one CASE another involves forced sex upon A YEAR OLD girl AND yet another concerns the repeated beatings OF A child age BY an aunt DOT one OF the beaten wives ALSO IS seeking A divorce DOT we follow the cases FROM the investigation OF complaints TO the outcomes OF the trials DOT the outcomes IN EACH CASE ARE favorable TO the women AND children DOT the perpetrators receive stiff prison terms AND OR fines the divorce IS GRANTED DOT br br the aggressive prosecution OF the child beating aunt demonstrates that these female criminal justice officials ARE indeed gender neutral WHEN it comes TO enforcing the law DOT ALSO noteworthy IS the RESPECT WITH which ALL parties INCLUDING those FOUND guilty ARE treated DOT this IS A highly important AND well made film DOT OF interest IS the fact that one OF the directors ms DOT longinotto ALSO co directed the film divorce iranian STYLE which dealt WITH related themes IN tehran DOT IN broken english WITH english subtitles DOT my grade b
label: safe

text: madison IS NOT too bad IF you LIKE simplistic non offensive FAMILY friendly fare AND MORE importantly IF you know absolutely NOTHING about unlimited hydroplane racing DOT IF LIKE me you grew up musical score DOT br br AND THEN there ARE the CLOSE up shots OF the drivers riding smoothly AND comfortably IN the cockpits AS IF they were relaxing IN the latest luxury limousines IN SOME cases taking TIME TO smile evilly AS they contemplate how best TO thwart the poor home town hero DOT OR IN one particularly ridiculous shot taking TIME TO spot jake lloyd giving A rocky salute FROM A bridge existed IN

text: tweaked A little BIT NOTHING could be A children s film DOT it s A very clever concept touches upon SOME interesting metaphysical themes AND goes against pretty much EVERY hollywood convention you can think OF DOT DOT DOT what goes against everything MORE than literally NOTHING NOTHING IS the story OF two friends who wish the world away WHEN everything goes wrong WITH their lives DOT ALL that s LEFT IS what they don T hate AND A big EMPTY white SPACE DOT it s hard TO focus A story ON just two actors FOR the majority OF your film especially WITHOUT ANY cuts TO anything going ON outside the plot DOT it focuses ON pretty much one subject but that s prime vincenzo natali territory DOT IF you ve seen CUBE you know already that he tends TO LIKE that TYPE OF situation DOT the NOTHING IN this movie IS apparently infinite SPACE but natali somehow manages TO make it somewhat claustrophobic IF ONLY because there s literally NOTHING ELSE AND nowhere ELSE TO GO DOT the actors sell it although you can tell these guys ARE friends anyway DOT two actors FROM CUBE RETURN here worth AND kazan but ARE entirely different CHARACTERS DOT they change throughout the story AND WHILE they re NOT the strongest actors IN the world they re AT LEAST believable DOT br br the reason i say this could be A children s film UNDER the RIGHT tweaks IS because aside FROM A few f bombs AND A somewhat unnecessary bloody dream SEQUENCE the whimsical AND often silly feel OF this movie could very much be digested easily BY kids DOT so i find it an odd choice that the writers decided TO ADD SOME crass LANGUAGE AND A small amount OF gore especially considering there isn T very much OF it DOT this could ve gotten A pg rating easily had they simply cut A few things OUT AND changed A little dialogue DOT there IS very little objectionable about this film but just enough TO keep parents FROM wanting their kids TO see it DOT i ONLY say that s A shame because NOT because i support censorship but because that may have been the ONLY thing preventing this movie FROM HAVING wider exposure DOT br br AT ANY rate this IS A reasonably entertaining film albeit WITH A few dragged OUT scenes DOT but FOR literally being about NOTHING AND focused entirely ON two CHARACTERS AND their interactions WITH absolutely NOTHING they DO A surprisingly good job FOR an independent film DOT
label: safe

text: HAVING seen CUBE i ve been A fan OF vincenzo natali s WORK DOT natali seems TO have this inept ability TO take A storyline AND hardly wring it our LIKE A wet towel FOR ALL the storyline he can muster DOT INSTEAD he lets the stories themselves unfold IN NATURAL ways so much IN fact that you may IN fact believe there IS this CUBE were people try TO ESCAPE OR IN the CASE OF NOTHING A LARGE EMPTY expanse WHERE there IS DOT DOT DOT NOTHING the advert had me hooked instantly DOT it seemed so SIMPLE take two CHARACTERS who NO one likes AND send them TO A world WHERE there IS NOTHING DOT natali does this so simply that you forget the logic that A place WHERE there IS NOTHING cannot exist DOT IN fact the world OF NOTHING becomes something OF an irony WITHIN the film DOT there s NOTHING there but ALSO something there DOT br br it might be A good TIME TO point OUT that the trailer IS highly misleading DOT i was fortunate enough TO actually understand that the film leaned TO A MORE comedic side than the trailer otherwise told so DOT therefore upon watching the film i laughed EVERY now AND again whereas someone who the advert mislead may find themselves utterly confused DOT br br IF i may take A MINUTE TO give the film SOME praise WHERE the film excels ON IS the concept DOT it IS A genius concept TO have A world OF NOTHING AND TO put two CHARACTERS there NOT two brilliant minded CHARACTERS who will philosophise AND WORK OUT their surroundings but two idiots who have absolutely NO clue AS TO WHERE the hell they ARE another strong point IS the film s cinematography though AT FIRST this may NOT seem it WHERE EACH wall north earth south west up AND down IS just A white plane A perception OF DEPTH becomes faulty DOT it IS hard TO determine WHERE things ARE placed IN the mis en scene DOT the cinematography has many moments WHERE this actually happens but FOR the most part the camera IS placed so that two CHARACTERS OR an OBJECT AND A CHARACTER ARE placed IN the foreground AND background allowing A sense OF DEPTH TO be realised DOT br br however this film does lack IN certain areas DOT the film IS relatively short but even so AFTER A WHILE the novelty OF this world OF NOTHING becomes rather dull AND you wish TO find SOME form OF resolution WITHIN the plot DOT we can ALSO argue that the acting IS once again questionable DOT these two CHARACTERS ARE IN A sense unlikeable therefore we feel NO sympathy AT ANY point FOR these CHARACTERS DOT however ON A flip side OF that the chemistry AND friendship BETWEEN the two CHARACTERS seems REAL enough but there IS something lacking DOT br br even so i DO RANK this AS A thoroughly enjoyable film DO NOT let the trailer fool you INTO thinking this IS another science fiction horror film DOT it IS much MORE OF A comedy than that it IS indeed worth watching though purely FOR the concept itself
label: safe

text: director vincenzo natali FIRST showed his penchant FOR CHARACTER based sci fi flicks WITH his short film elevated wherein people remain trapped IN an elevator WHILE unseen monsters roam the building DOT his follow up feature project CUBE released later that YEAR had A very SIMILAR premise this TIME WITH people AND INSTEAD OF an elevator it was A vast expansion OF interlocking cubic deathtraps DOT BOTH were admirable attempts TO take the sci fi genre A step further BY deliberately declining TO SHOW almost ANY visual stimulation choosing INSTEAD TO spend AS much TIME AS possible focusing ON the human ELEMENT how the CHARACTERS act react AND interact UNDER incomprehensible AND dangerous conditions DOT AFTER his exploration INTO the mainstream WITH s cypher natali has come back TO his bizarre CHARACTER film trend TO bring us NOTHING his latest AND BY far most optimistic AND comedic take ON the wide cinematic world OF what IF br br dave david hewlett AND andrew andrew miller ARE life LONG friends brought together BY A mutual detachment FROM society AND A lack OF ANY one ELSE TO be WITH DOT dave who has ALWAYS been hindered BY A selfish AND somewhat dimwitted nature lives rent FREE WITH andrew AT his ill located AND ill constructed house WHERE he often takes advantage OF andrew s neurotic AND antisocial mentality DOT despite ALL this the two misfits ARE happy together UNTIL one DAY their deep CHARACTER flaws coupled WITH SOME astronomically bad luck land them IN the middle OF SOME pretty serious jail sentence worthy trouble DOT ON top OF this they discover that their house has been deemed unfit FOR existence AND IS scheduled TO be demolished BEFORE sunset so IN the hazy nightmarish panic OF everything going wrong FOR them they wish that the whole world would just disappear DOT AND it does DOT br br going ANY further WITH the synopsis would compromise A lot OF the film s slow occasionally too slow reveal about what s happened TO dave AND andrew AND how they deal WITH their NEW reality DOT natali s fascination WITH studying human behavior UNDER duress ala the birds IS here IN spades but simply BY making the main CHARACTERS friends rather than strangers he s able TO break away FROM the thriller horror ELEMENT OF this premise TO OPEN it up TO A MORE comfortable AND optimistic LEVEL DOT it s almost AS IF he s made the aphoristic opposite OF CUBE DOT br br OF course the film IS NOT minutes OF laughter AND sunshine DOT IN keeping WITH fundamental realism our two anti heroes DYNAMIC often becomes antagonistic sometimes WITH rather nasty results DOT LIKE the desert island game the film looks AT how even best friends WHEN LEFT alone together can fall apart but AT the same TIME it shows that friends ARE vital TO the quality OF existence DOT IN A very twisted sci fi way this IS A feel good flick WITH good heart AND good intentions DOT br br however there ARE A few qualms TO be had WITH NOTHING DOT WHILE the two LEAD actors hewlett AND miller DO well WITH their parts their CHARACTERS ARE NOT nearly AS interesting AS they should have been considering it IS completely up TO them TO entertain us FOR the better part OF an HOUR DOT there IS SOME development IN the relationship AND personalities OF dave AND andrew SOME background IS given but ultimately NOT enough DOT A generous viewer will sit through the less engaging portions OF the film TO see it through TO the END but cynics will probably give up pretty fast DOT br br acting AS mentioned IS adequate AND considering the amount OF green screen WORK that would ve been needed reasonably convincing DOT david hewlett AND andrew miller who BOTH wrote co wrote the screenplay have been LONG TIME friends OF vincenzo natali hewlett has IN fact featured IN EVERY film natali has made DOT perhaps it was their creative INPUT that steered this film IN A MORE positive direction DOT nonetheless the story could have been A lot MORE involving DOT GRANTED it IS relatively entertaining considering that NO pun intended NOTHING really happens but you GET the impression that IN MORE experienced hands A lot MORE could ve been done WITH this premise DOT br br IN ALL fairness NOTHING IS an impressive piece OF WORK IN many ways DOT the concept IS interesting the direction IS inventive the script works ON A human LEVEL AND most OF ALL it shows A progression IN natali s creative mentality DOT FOR fans OF his WORK this will be A delight AND FOR OTHERS it will be A nice way TO pass A little unwanted TIME DOT it s just A shame that the director s fixation ON human drama prevented it FROM being the great fun film it could have been DOT
label: safe

text: the premise OF this movie has been tickling my imagination FOR quite SOME TIME now DOT we ve ALL heard OR READ about it IN SOME kind OF con TEXT DOT what would you DO IF you were ALL alone IN the world what would you DO IF the entire world suddenly disappeared IN front OF your eyes IN fact the LAST part IS actually what happens TO dave AND andrew two room mates living IN A run down house IN the middle OF A freeway SYSTEM DOT andrew IS A nervous wreck TO say the LEAST AND dave IS considered being one OF the biggest losers OF society DOT that alone IS the main reason TO why these two guys GET so well along because they simply ONLY have EACH other TO turn TO WHEN comforting IS needed DOT just UNTIL DOT DOT DOT br br straight FROM the beginning OF the film lots AND lots OF problems happen TO them DOT BOTH OF them GET involved WITH crime andrew suffers FROM paranoia AND simply doesn T dare going OUT OF the house DOT dave IS unsuccessful AT his job AND his colleagues don T TREAT him very well AND WITH the RESPECT he deserves DOT the amount OF problems they face keeps increasing UNTIL that one DAY WHERE they may have TO face the inevitable AND deal WITH it DOT this IS just too much FOR them AND they wish that everything would just GO away DOT DOT DOT AND OF course that IS exactly what happens DOT br br the rest OF the story places dave AND andrew IN this world OF nothingness DOT AT FIRST they ARE surprised AND have problems understanding AND dealing WITH the features OF this crazy environment but later ON they find OUT that they can DO just about everything they want because it seems AS IF they ARE the ONLY ones still LEFT DOT br br NOTHING features an incredibly small CAST IN fact besides the FIRST couple OF shots FROM the film we ONLY see dave david hewlett AND andrew andrew miller IN the entire film DOT it IS clear that IN ORDER TO pull this OFF the CAST has TO be MORE than up FOR the task because IN A world WHERE NOTHING EXISTS there IS NOTHING that can distract the viewer IN ANY way DOT vincenzo has decided TO USE A reasonable amount OF CLOSE up head shots TO make it MORE interesting AND it actually works quite well DOT director OF photography derek rogers ALSO has A nice way OF teasing the audience BY withholding visual information especially AT times WHERE A CHARACTER sees something AND reacts TO it but we don T see it RIGHT away DOT br br obviously this can T be an EVENT driven film AND it s NOT DOT much OF the ACTION happens outside their house WHEN they MOVE around IN the void DOT AND that s WHERE SOME OF the most hilarious scenes take place especially IN the CASE OF WHEN andrew discovers A candy bar DOT br br now one could be thinking how does NOTHING look LIKE well it looks LIKE NOTHING indeed DOT the entire world OF NOTHING IS white DOT DOT DOT white NO matter IN what direction you look DOT this IS the weakness OF this film DOT DOT DOT AFTER an HOUR OR less it s getting extremely boring TO look AT AND there has TO be events TO make sure it s MORE interesting TO look AT DOT thank god there ARE SOME DOT FOR example AT times WHEN the two lads due TO the properties OF NOTHING ARE able TO jump really high AS IF NOTHING IS made OUT OF DOT DOT DOT tofu AS andrew claims DOT it s fun TO see how they ARE instantly able TO USE NOTHING TO become gods OF their own little society DOT br br one OF the best parts OF the film IS the SET DOT DOT DOT production designer jasna stefanovic has done A beautiful job IN this film the house IN which these two guys live IS so unnaturally fun TO look AT still it seems RIGHT FOR these two TO be living IN A place LIKE this DOT ALL IN ALL the production design IS WITH NO doubt one OF the most powerful aspects OF this film AT it really makes the film worth watching DOT DOT DOT br br however the very best part OF the film IS the acting DOT BOTH david hewlett AND andrew miller really look LIKE the professional actors they BOTH ARE DOT the camera IS ON them FOR EVERY SECOND OF the film AND AS previously said there ARE just about NO props IN the film they ARE really ON A bare stage DOT WITH plenty OF CHARACTER development AND SOME decent one liners clever dialogue AT times hilariously stupid it ALL works TO that END AND this really moves the movie away FROM the low budget area TO well crafted handwork DOT br br let s talk A little about the visual effects because they ARE definitely worth mentioning DOT NOTHING features digital visual effects AND prosthetics that EQUALS ANY modern horror film DOT there s A rather horrifying dream SEQUENCE IN the film AND although the drews have milked that scene completely it s still fun TO watch DOT one OF the best visual effects IN the film IS AT the END WHERE andrew AND dave suddenly discover their powers IN this environment they have the abilities TO wish everything away so what IF they can DO it the other way around AND make things appear br br NOTHING IS A bright AND well lit movie it really helps promoting the idea OF them probably being dead this IS IN fact one OF their theories but NOTHING IS A comedy AND it slowly destroys its own theory DOT we don T know WHERE they ARE OR what has happened TO them DOT we don T know IF they will ever GET OUT because the movie ends BEFORE we see anything LIKE that DOT the ending BY the way IS NOT AS good AS it could ve been DOT it s rather easy TO predict what IS going TO happen still the writers have thought up A few incidents that help make it A little MORE interesting AND IN the END it s A reasonably satisfactory one DOT br br take hollow man kill bill CUBE epoch AND lots OF other films AND you have NOTHING DOT it really IS an amalgam OF different styles still there IS NO other film AT LEAST that i know OF NOTHING IS really LIKE DOT FOR the people remembering the original CUBE production commentary ON its dvd may remember that vincenzo natali talked about how he came up WITH the story OF CUBE DOT he talks about him AND andr bijelic HAVING been room mates AT A TIME AND they BOTH were IN this extremely dull room WITH NO hope OF getting OUT NOTHING could very well be the screened VERSION OF the origin OF the CUBE story AND TO that END it s almost LIKE one OF the CUBE prequels DOT br br what can i say i enjoyed NOTHING it IS A great movie AND the different parts OF the movie ARE extremely well made WITH tons OF intelligent ideas still i feel the movie IS missing something AND i have problems finding OUT precisely what it IS DOT DOT DOT maybe IF we have A NOTHING i can answer that question DOT NOTHING IS A great film but NOT AS good AS i expected it TO be DOT br br FINAL rating DOT

burn their ration books destroy AND IGNORE their clothing coupons flagrantly disregard british licencing laws etc declaring themselves fully independent FROM britain DOT br br however what THEN ARE told that due TO developments this IS now A matter OF FOREIGN policy which his majesty s government IS reluctant TO become involved which leaves the residents high AND dry DOT they DO however DECLARE the area A legal frontier AND AS such SET up A fully equipped customs office AT the END OF the road mainly TO monitor smuggling than TO ensure ANY safety FOR the residents OF pimlico DOT br br eventually the border IS closed altogether starting A major siege WITH the bugundian residents slowly running OUT OF water AND food but never the less fighting ON IN TRUE british STYLE DOT AS one bugundian resident quotes we re english AND we ALWAYS were english AND it s just because we ARE english we ARE fighting so hard TO be bugundians br br A sentiment that IS soon echoed throughout the whitehall who has fought OFF so may invaders throughout the centuries finally be brought TO it s knees BY this NEW batch OF foreigners especially AS these ones ARE english br br great tale AND great fun throughout DOT NOT TO be missed DOT

text: my former cambridge contemporary simon heffer today A writer AND journalist has put FORWARD the theory that just AS british film makers IN the eighties were often critical OF what they CALLED thatcher s britain the ealing comedies were intended AS satires ON attlee s britain the britain which had come INTO being AFTER the labour victory IN the GENERAL election DOT this theory was presumably NOT intended TO apply TO say kind hearts AND coronets which IS IF anything A satire ON the edwardian UPPER classes OR TO the ladykillers OR the lavender hill mob BOTH OF which may contain SOME satire but ARE NOT political IN nature DOT it can however be applied TO most OF the other films IN the series especially passport TO pimlico DOT br br pimlico IS OR AT LEAST was IN the forties A predominantly working CLASS district OF london SET ON the north bank OF the thames about A mile FROM victoria station DOT it IS NOT quite correct TO say AS has often been said that the film IS about pimlico declaring itself independent OF britain DOT what happens IS that an ancient charter comes TO light proving that IN the fifteenth century the area was ceded BY king edward iv TO the duchy OF burgundy DOT this means that technically pimlico IS an independent STATE AND has been FOR nearly five hundred years irrespective OF the wishes OF its inhabitants DOT the government promise TO pass A special act OF parliament TO rectify the anomaly but UNTIL the act receives the royal assent the area remains outside the united kingdom AND british laws DO NOT apply DOT br br because pimlico IS NOT subject TO british law the landlord OF the LOCAL pub IS FREE TO OPEN whatever hours he chooses AND LOCAL shopkeepers can sell whatever they please TO whomever they please unhindered BY the rationing laws DOT WHEN other traders START moving INTO the area TO sell their goods IN the streets the british authorities ARE horrified BY what they regard AS legalised black marketeering AND seal OFF the area TO try AND FORCE the burgundians AS the people OF pimlico have renamed themselves TO surrender DOT br br many OF the ealing comedies have AS their central theme the idea OF the little man taking ON the SYSTEM either AS an individual AS happens IN the man IN the white suit OR the lavender hill mob OR AS part OF A larger community AS happens IN whisky galore OR the titfield thunderbolt DOT the central theme OF passport IS that OF ordinary men AND women taking ON bureaucracy AND government imposed regulations which seemed TO be an increasingly important feature OF life IN the britain OF the forties DOT the film s particular target IS the rationing SYSTEM DOT during the war the SYSTEM had been accepted BY most people AS A necessary sacrifice IN the fight against nazism but it became increasingly politically controversial WHEN the government tried TO retain it IN peacetime DOT it was A major factor IN the growing unpopularity OF the attlee administration which had been elected WITH A LARGE majority IN AND organisations such AS the british housewives league were SET up TO campaign FOR the abolition OF rationing DOT i cannot agree WITH the reviewer who stated that the main targets OF the film s satire were the spivs black marketeers who play A relatively minor part IN the ACTION OR the housewives league who DO NOT appear AT ALL DOT the satire IS very much targeted AT the bureaucrats who ARE portrayed either AS HAVING A rules FOR rules sake mentality OR A desire TO pass the buck AND avoid HAVING TO take ANY ACTION AT ALL DOT br br i suspect that IF the film were TO be made today it would have A different ending WITH pimlico remaining independent AS A british VERSION OF monaco OR san marino DOT indeed i suspect that today this concept would probably serve AS the basis OF A tv sitcom rather than A film DOT IN however four years AFTER the END OF the war the film makers were keen stress patriotism AND british IDENTITY so the film ends WITH pimlico being reabsorbed INTO britain DOT one OF the best known lines FROM the film IS we ALWAYS were english AND we ALWAYS will be english AND it s just because we ARE english that we re sticking up FOR our RIGHT TO be burgundians DOT there IS A sharp contrast BETWEEN the rather heartless attitude OF officialdom WITH the common sense tolerance AND good humour OF the cockneys OF pimlico ALL OF which ARE presented AS being quintessentially british CHARACTERISTICS DOT br br most OF the ACTION takes place during A summer drought AND sweltering heatwave but IN the LAST scene AFTER pimlico has rejoined the uk the temperature drops AND it starts TO pour WITH rain DOT GLOBAL warming may have altered things slightly but FOR many years part OF being british was the ability TO HOLD the belief whatever STATISTICS might say TO the contrary that britain had an abnormally wet climate DOT the ability TO make jokes about that climate was equally important DOT br br there IS A good performance FROM stanley holloway AS arthur pemberton the grocer AND small TIME LOCAL politician who becomes the prime minister OF FREE pimlico AND an amusing cameo FROM margaret rutherford AS A batty history professor DOT IN the main however this IS appropriately enough FOR A film about A small community pulling together an example OF ensemble acting WITH NO REAL star performances but WITH everyone making A contribution TO an excellent film DOT it lacks the ill will AND rancour OF many MORE recent satirical films but its wit AND satire ARE NO less effective FOR ALL that DOT it remains one OF the funniest satires ON bureaucracy ever made AND WITH the possible EXCEPTION OF kind hearts AND coronets IS my personal favourite among the ealing comedies DOT
label: safe

text: the mind boggles AT exactly what about universal soldier merited A sequel DOT since the REAL star dolph lundgren would NOT be able TO reprise his ROLE FROM the original there IS already scant reason TO indulge oneself IN this obvious tax WRITE OFF DOT bold attempts ARE made TO fill the gap WITH professional wrestler bill goldberg AND martial arts expert michael jai white DOT TO their credit they give their ACTION SEQUENCES A good sense OF excitement DOT bill goldberg looks LIKE he IS HAVING the TIME OF his life ON this film AND he makes A fair stab AT filling the requisite comedic villain ROLE DOT FOR once his ROLE IS the kind that involves repeating the same line A few times AND it does NOT GET irritating DOT the problem FROM the audience s point OF VIEW IS that neither OF these gentlemen really have the sense OF comic timing OR minor humility that makes lundgren such A pleasure TO watch IN almost ALL OF his films DOT AND therein lies the problem DOT you DO NOT GO TO see A van damme film because you want serious ACTION DOT you GO because you want comedy however unintentional DOT br br unbeknownst TO many people universal soldier was followed BY two direct TO video sequels DOT i have ONLY seen the FIRST which had production VALUES so bad one can ONLY wonder IF it was meant TO be SOME kind OF elaborate joke DOT matt battaglia was so terrible IN the ROLE OF luc deveraux that FOR once IN his career the sight OF jean claude van damme comes AS A welcome relief DOT the film MORE OR less completely disregards the stories OF the aforementioned direct TO video sequels AND INSTEAD begins A whole NEW story SET an indeterminate TIME AFTER the events OF the original DOT AFTER years OF investigation AND explanation the unisol project IS still going ahead WITH SOME minor modifications DOT FOR one the NEW unisols ARE stronger AND MORE damage resistant than their earlier cousins DOT FOR another ALL OF the unisols ARE now UNDER the direction OF A supercomputer CALLED seth DOT IN the early parts OF the film seth EXISTS primarily AS A series OF abstract graphics WITHIN A glass dome DOT br br being that the film barely lasts MORE than eighty minutes we ARE quickly told that funding TO the military IS being cut DOT the unisol project IS ON the chopping block which essentially means that seth will be turned OFF DOT seth somehow overhearing this conversation through means that ARE never really explained decides TO mobilise the unisols AS an army against those seeking TO shut him down DOT his ONLY problem IS that EVERY so often A code IS required TO be put INTO his SYSTEM IN ORDER TO prevent automatic shutdown DOT two individuals possess the code IN question DOT seth kills the FIRST IN short ORDER AND those who ARE familiar WITH the plot kit that van damme s films ARE constructed OUT OF will guess WITHIN five seconds who the SECOND happens TO be DOT the rest OF the film revolves around the unisols attempts TO GET the code OUT OF van damme WITHOUT injuring him too badly DOT A subplot WITH A daughter AND A reporter IS woven INTO the film but it adds about AS much TO the story AS van damme does TO the profession OF acting DOT br br the film IS loaded TO the brim WITH ridiculous lines AND clichs DOT WHEN seth transplants his command MODULE INTO the body OF michael jai white we GET A speech about how the TIME OF the humans IS OVER DOT he goes ON TO tell his foot soldiers how fear AND mortality will be humanity s weakness es DOT gee seth you mean they will NOT be our strong points ALL kidding aside the short LENGTH OF the film IS BOTH the film s weakness AND its strength DOT it leaves the ACTION WITHOUT adequate setup DOT IN the original we ARE given A very thorough explanation OF the unisols how they WORK AND how they ARE brought TO the STATE that IS seen IN the majority OF the film DOT here the writer seems TO take it FOR GRANTED that the viewer knows what A unisol IS AND how they operate DOT AT LEAST IN the original A moment OF curiosity AND wonder was created BY leaving the explanation FOR later IN the film WHEN the hero lies IN A tub OF ice DOT here one OF the villains IS shot WITH A gun that leaves massive holes IN his uniform AND presumably his body getting up EVERY TIME WITHOUT stopping FOR breath DOT br br i tend TO reserve the score OF one FOR films that ARE so bad that they become entertaining IN A completely unintentional manner DOT IF you can see it ON the cheap knock yourself OUT DOT this IS the kind OF film that makes me mourn the loss OF mystery science theatre DOT
label: safe

text: it s TRUE that danny steinmann s the unseen IS A simplistic horror thriller WITH A very predictable plot NO particular attempts FOR twists OR surprises whatsoever AND featuring literally EVERY single clich the genre has brought FORWARD OVER the decades but that doesn T necessarily make it A bad film DOT ON the contrary my friends AND i were pleasantly surprised BY this obscure but nevertheless intense little s shock feature that mainly benefices FROM A handful OF brutal images AND A downright brilliant casting DOT the beautiful AND ambitious reporter jennifer fast AND two OF her equally attractive friends travel TO A little californian town TO shoot A documentary ON the anniversary festival but their hotel forgot TO register their booking DOT IN their SEARCH FOR A place TO stay the trio runs INTO the exaggeratedly friendly but suspicious museum curator ernest keller who invites the girls TO stay AT his remote countryside mansion DOT one BY one the girls experience that keller AND his extremely introvert AND submissive sister victoria hide A dark AND murderous secret inside their house DOT the unseen can easily be described AS A cheap AND ultimately perverse amalgamation OF the horror classics psycho AND the texas chainsaw massacre DOT the plot IS A series OF familiar themes that became notorious AND endlessly imitated due TO these two films LIKE twisted FAMILY secrets IN the cellar voyeurism crazed inbred killers AND A very unappetizing treatment OF chickens DOT still i don T consider these TO be negative remarks AS the unseen IS A completely unpretentious AND modestly unsettling thriller that clearly never intended TO be the GREATEST horror classic OF the decade DOT although the denouement OF the plot IS pretty clear quite fast director steinmann attempts TO maintain the mystery BY keeping the evil present IN the house unseen LIKE the title promised DOT the casting choices AND acting performances ARE truly what lift this sleeper above the LEVEL OF mediocre DOT sydney lassick immortalized since his ROLE AS the overly anxious psychiatric patient charley cheswick IN one flew OVER the cuckoo s nest IS truly the ideal choice FOR the ROLE OF ernest keller DOT his persistent friendliness AND almost naturally perverted appearance ARE exactly what the CHARACTER needed DOT ALSO stephen furst who eventually turns FROM the unseen INTO the seen gives away A tremendous performance AS junior DOT he looks AND acts LIKE an authentic handicapped man AND his attempts TO GET CLOSE TO jennifer IN the basement ARE genuinely unnerving DOT the unseen IS A slow AND predictable but nevertheless potent early s film that will certainly appeal TO fans OF s exploitation AND generally weird stuff DOT
label: safe

text: IN its depiction OF A miserable milanese underclass this film was probably quite revealing IN its DAY DOT however i GET the feeling that neorealism was never really director de sica s bag since here he decided TO try AND CREATE SOME sort OF modern fable centring around A boy that had been FOUND IN A cabbage patch BY an OLD dear IN the country DOT AFTER spending most OF his childhood IN an orphanage toto ends up living IN A shantytown IN milan DOT he organises the inhabitants INTO community ACTION AND keeps their spirits up BY swanning around WITH an annoyingly constant smile ON his face AND testing them ON their times TABLES DOT that nobody tells him WHERE TO stick his times TABLES IS beyond me AS these people have far MORE important things TO think about LIKE WHERE the NEXT pot noodle IS going TO come FROM DOT anyway de sica THEN uses A sublimely subtle dramatic device IN ORDER TO highlight exactly why these poor sods ARE WHERE they ARE DOT it s ALL down TO capitalism OF course AND IN ORDER TO illustrate this he has the miserables discover A fountain OF oil ON their land DOT brilliant TO his credit though BY this TIME he has given up ON making A serious film AND the capitalists appear AS severe caricatures ALL fur coats AND cigars DOT they want that land but our mathematical hero will NOT support such nonsense DOT BY A bizarre stroke OF luck his OLD deceased guardian FROM the cabbage patch days appears IN the sky AND gives him A magic dove DOT he uses it TO shower gifts ON his mates who prove just AS greedy AS the cigar men DOT i reckon this film was A missed opportunity DOT TO address the theme OF poverty AS NOT many film makers had done UNTIL THEN AND THEN GET caught up IN A fairy tale TO me seems A BIT daft DOT how come great directors GET away WITH child LIKE plot turns LIKE the ones we see here hans christian anderson would probably have balked AT the idea OF HAVING the poor folk flying OFF OVER the milan duomo AND ON TO A higher place ON broomsticks DOT de sica however IS proclaimed AS A genius FOR this DOT surely the fact that these people ARE so poor that their faith IS unswerving AND that miracles never happen TO them IS enough FOR ANY story teller TO WORK ON DOT br br
label: safe

text: dolph lundgren IS back detention marks dolphs FIRST film IN nearly years AND that IS FOLLOWING the delayed hidden agenda DOT this film still marks an improvement FOR dolph OVER his cheapie trilogy OF jill rips agent red AND stormcatcher DOT however this film IS well below the standard OF hidden agenda which was better IN almost EVERY RESPECT DOT what this film does have IN it s favour FROM dolph s previous outing IS A sense OF cheesy fun DOT the film ALSO has A rejuvenated dolph back IN A high ACTION ROLE AND it s good TO see dolph doing his own stunts again DOT br br the films story IS ludicrous AND prime b movie material DOT an ex military man IS now A teacher AND ON his LAST DAY OF teaching whilst taking A detention CLASS he runs INTO SOME slovakian bad guys who have taken OVER the school TO USE AS cover FOR A big drug deal DOT the film has NO originality but IN A movie OF this TYPE you need TO have A sense OF fun WITH ALL the cliches DOT IF you take it too seriously the audience will find little TO enjoy DOT thankfully the filmmakers don T take matters too seriously AND along WITH ALL the ACTION cliches you can think OF AND the predictability this film has A so bad it s enjoyable kind OF vibe DOT br br WHERE the film IS let down IS miss USING A fairly decent budget DOT the budget OF around million has NOT been well spent DOT it s ALL up ON screen WITH plenty OF carnage AND big explosions but A lot OF the shootouts lack imagination DOT the opening ACTION IS okay but AFTER that the good moments become MORE sparse DOT there ARE SOME good moments DOT you have A car careering through school hallways FOR example AND A decent shootout AT the beginning WITH plenty OF destruction DOT the rest OF the shootouts ARE fairly mechanical but there IS plenty going ON onscreen DOT br br AS FOR the CAST DOT hidden agenda boasted the best CAST dolph has worked WITH IN ages DOT there was A good standard OF actors FOR A dtv film DOT this however has problems DOT the actors ARE ON the most part bad DOT the bad guys ARE terrible but the LEAD bad guy has A kind OF enjoyable cheesiness because alex karsis plays it so OVER the top AND WITHOUT the hint OF ANY menace that you can laugh AT the pure badness DOT the teenagers OF the piece ARE actually good but they ARE playing such cliched CHARACTERS DOT they ALL hate authority EACH other AND ALL have bad attitudes AND OF course BY the END they learn important life lessons but generally they ARE decent AND chris collins IN particular has A likeability DOT this movie IS ALL about dolph though DOT WHILE this film IS nowhere near his best it IS nowhere near his worst DOT it ALSO marks A turning point IN his career DOT he IS now back IN good shape AND will be IN even better shape IN his NEXT film direct ACTION DOT dolph looks enthusiastic here he does ALL his own stunts AND it IS good TO see him play the typical ACTION man running FROM explosions IN slow mo one liners AND handling LARGE weapons again IN A movie LIKE his older ones albeit WITH less flair AND imagination than cliched films LIKE army OF one DOT it IS good TO see dolph looking energised DOT his films OF the LAST OR so years have seen dolph looking A little MORE weary AND USING doubles A lot he still does ALL the fights himself though but the NEW streamlined dolph seems up FOR it DOT br br overall this IS watchable IF ONLY FOR the cheese VALUE AND dolph IN prime ACTION man MODE DOT there s NOT A single surprise but it has A laughably inept kind OF charm DOT

text: FROM it s uninspiring title TO the flat acting performances curdled IS very much an unremarkable film throughout DOT the film has gained SOME fans BY way OF the fact that quentin tarantino s NAME IS attached TO it AND the silly AND OUT OF place nod TO the rodriguez tarantino flick FROM dusk till dawn DOT these things DO NOT make A great movie however AND this IS MORE than evident ALL the way through curdled DOT the film suffers FROM an ALL too obvious lack OF ideas AND it tries TO mask this WITH murders that ARE meant TO be stylish AND events that ARE supposed TO be disturbing DOT the mexican music score that accompanies many OF the SEQUENCES IN the film IS obviously meant TO be cool but it s becomes annoying very quickly especially AS aside FROM the fact that the LEAD CHARACTER IS mexican it doesn T fit WITH the tone OF the movie DOT the film s plot IS typically offbeat AND it follows A gorehound who because OF her obsession WITH grisly murders takes A job WITH A firm that movie AND aside FROM talking TO his victims AND standing around trying TO look menacing he s pretty much wasted DOT angela jones OR rather the taxi driver FROM pulp fiction takes the LEAD ROLE AS the murder obsessed young woman AND it IS ALWAYS clear that it s her involvement WITH pulp fiction that won her this ROLE NOT her acting ability DOT she may have been good enough IN her small ROLE IN tarantino s masterpiece but she doesn T have the talent TO LEAD A film BY herself DOT she looks lost AND OUT OF place FOR the majority OF the film AND IF it weren T FOR her latino accent she wouldn T convince the audience that she s A weirdo ON ANY LEVEL DOT curdled IS A one hundred PERCENT proof piece OF forgettable trash DOT films LIKE this often win themselves praise FOR invention OR black comedic antics but this one fails ON ALL levels DOT whether you re A tarantino fan william baldwin fan horror fan OR just A movie buff this IS one TO miss DOT
